content: If you ever have a problem rest assured, customer service is very sorry and understands, but there is nothing they can do. Remember this because you'll hear it before EVERY sentence they say. Most recently a brand new fire stick broke within a month. We were sent a refurbished one to replace it! The rep did not understand what my problem was despite his constant insisting he did understand, and was very sorry, but there was nothing he could do. Beyond all of this you now have to worry about fake reviews and counterfeit items. I think it's time we realized Amazon is an evil company. You guys make Walmart seem like a wholesome company!
title: “Worst customer service in the biz”

content: So I have been using amazon for the past two years and I have never left a review as I just couldn't be bothered. For once, I wrote a review as I actually liked the product but then later receiving a message on amazon saying that I won't be able to post any more reviews as I was violating against the policies. I called them a few times later receiving an e mail saying that I ever the had a relationship with some seller, or I was getting free or discounted stuff and that's the reason I was posting a good review and also my account had been banned from writing a reiview ever since. What really pisses me off is that there is  always a botton there where you can choose to leave a review but when I do, I get a ban. After called them 10 times and speaking to 5 different managers, about a month after the issue. What I got told on the phone was basically, we will not provide you with anymore information, we will not prove anything to you and the decision is final, happy or not, deal with with it' how bad does it sound? All I asked was, if they are determined' I was violating against their 3 policies like I have said above, prove it to me that I actually know the seller or I was getting free stuff? But no, I don't get any and I have to deal with it. The very last manager that I spoke to had a terrible attitude and they don't treat you like customers.
title: “Worst customer service ever!”

content:
No reting this site, amezon costomer satisfaction is 0%, this is bed site, no any process refund, no any help for refund,
Bad bad and bad site....

Plz no purchase from this site because costomer care is bad, no helpfull in account details in. 

Plz another site use for purchase
title: “Never purchase from this site”

content: I've paid for prime for a few months now and my last 3 orders that were guaranteed in 2 days were not here in 2 days. 2 were a day late and one was 2 days late. I contacted them to complain and they did nothing. I paid for prime for the 2 day delivery and they can't meet the deadline. I cancelled my membership and won't be using it again.
title: “Prime sucks”

content: I ordered a Nintendo switch and a few accessories for it. My fiance and I are huge gamers and and have been wanting to get one for a while. Now for clarifications I'm going to mention that over a year ago we had a nasty problem with package theft in my area, the police reports were filed and everything so now I have all of my packages set to be picked up from a carrier facility . Back to the reviews, my package arrived at the UPS pick up location on time, unfortunately it was missing an item I had ordered. No big deal right? I'll just contact customer service let them know it wasn't included in my package and we can sort this out right? Nope! I contacted CS and they asked me to wait a few days so they could investigate and that maybe it had just been misshipped alright cool no problem. The next day I get and email stating that I've had a high number of "missing/stolen orders" returns and that I should review the return policy. I'm obviously confused cause as I had said its been well over a year since the only incident I've ever had with stolen packages. I contact CS again and they tell me I need to file a police report before they can go any further and provide them with information about the report....??? By this point I've explained to them several times that I had the item set for pick up from a carrier location so it wasn't stolen it just wasn't sent. I'm normally not the type of person who says they're gonna cut ties with a company but Amazon has gone out of their way to place blame on the carrier and myself for this incident and it really shows what kind of company they really are.
title: “Demanded I file a police report for items they said must be stolen when they just didn't ship them”

content: I have been using Amazon religiously for years, and have always loved the convenience of the fast and reliable shipping. However, over the last months, I have encountered FOUR shipping issues, either stating that my product was somehow damaged and sent back and that I should order a new one myself, lost and I should order a new one, or not delivered because "they did not want to leave a package unattended" even though they always leave my packages by the door for the last 4-5 years AND had left a package from a different order DURING THE SAME DELIVERY. Now they are just returning the item to the seller without even telling me, after they told me they would deliver as soon as possible. Prior to the last month, I had never encountered any problems with Amazon, and now all these problems are occurring and I am wary when placing an order, almost anticipating some kind of error. Amazon used to be reliable, and now all that has gone down in the dumps. Will be canceling my Prime Membership, and will NOT be using this company anymore.
title: “Amazon shipping has gone in the dumps”

content: Realized we've been being charged by Amazon for a "sellers" account that we do not control and is not associated with any of the emails we own. Secondly Amazon is charging a credit card we rarely use when buying from them. Amazon will not give us information because our emails are not associated with the sellers account, yet they keep charging our card (14 times to the tune of $559.96). They finally agreed to deactivate the card, but will not take responsibility for the money. (The credit card company is taking responsibility for some, but not all of it.) Gone over the statements carefully & these are the ONLY charges that do not fit. The problem seems to be with Amazon & only Amazon, yet they do not assume responsibility. Advise that you do not leave your personal information (billing/ship to addresses, credit card info, etc) on Amazon and cut WAY back on your Amazon purchases!
title: “Beware of Your Info on Amazon”

content:
At 7pm, my latest order prompted a message, ""We tried to deliver your package.
Unfortunately we couldn't enter your building but we will try again. If your address requires an access code, please provide it below." The delivery was being sent to an AMAZON LOCKER that is supposedly accessible 24/7. There was NO EXCUSE for failing delivery. I have previously had packages go missing, so I figured it would be safe to try an amazon locker. Since the failed delivery, I have read some disturbing info about lockers being unable to be opened. I'm starting to feel like this is personal. As their "good faith gesture", they offered me a $5.00 coupon toward my next QUALIFYING SOLD BY/SHIPPED BY Amazon order. Yep. Give them $20. more and they'll make up for their latest abominable mistake. I'm going to film opening the locker, because I'm expecting it to be EMPTY. Extremely great incentive to BUY LOCAL.
title: “Fail delivering to Amazon Lockers”

content: I have been a loyal Amazon customer for many years. On January 19, 2019 I ordered an accessory for my smartphone on the Amazon website. It later turned out that this item was sold on the Amazon Marketplace by a Chinese vendor who shipped it by China Post. Since January 23 the shipment has been sitting at a Chinese postal sorting facility in Shenzhen City, without moving anywhere. In response to my complaint Shana W. of Amazon's Executive Customer Relations wrote me that there was nothing they could do and that they would not answer any further message on this matter. Her message was full of gibberish like "You won’t be able to submit a claim." It is now February 1 and there is no sight of the order anywhere. Amazon's CEO Jeff Bezos has ignored my personal message.as well.
title: “Amazon's poor service”

content: I was billed yesterday for the subscription of Amazon Prime service which I did never choose or authorized. They used my credit card data stored from my last transaction at Dec 12. It is a fraud. I thought Amazon.com was a safe place to store my credit card data but unfortunately it is not true. I will think twice before buy anything there again
title: “They used my credit card data without authorization”

content: I place an order for a book on Amazon and the delivery options if i selected a trial of Prime would result in a delivery on a specified day (2 days) from order date.   I then subscribed, placed the order, received an email confirmation with the delivery date clearly printed on the email.  I also received numerous other solicitations to try other services now that i was a prime member.  ON the day the item was to be delivered i receive an email saying the order would be delivered tomorrow, a day later than promised!   I needed that product for work that day, and now it will not be here on time.  AMAZON boasts about the benefits of prime, and has no problem overcharging us for something they cannot deliver on time anyway! Next time, i will go to the big box store and pick up the item the same day!  I feel AMAZON is a conglomerate that is gobbling up all the small retailers so they can manage the world!  IF i could give them a -000 rating i would.  DON't get caught up in this conglomerate hype, please support local retailers so they can stay around.  Amazon someday will get its just reward,
title: “Promised  delivery date with prime subscription - CRAP!!!!!”

content: Same thing keeps happening. Dealing with customer services then Seller Support jumps in. I can't reply as that requires a seller account which I don't currently have or want. So I tell customer services that. Yet told them 6 times today and said seller support NOT to contact me ever again as this is trolling and the employee ought to be disciplined. Of course the messages keep coming with NOTHING from customer services. Seriously thinking of legal action for harassment. Thoughts? Btw writing similar review on Trustpilot and they said using the word "idiots" is inappropriate language. I can think of worse...
title: “Crap customer service is their problem.”

content: If I could give it zero stars, I would. Amazon is the worst company to ever exist. It is making people lazy as hell and it is costing my dad hundreds of thousands of dollars a year. It is also beginning to put my favorite stores out of business. I would give anything to have amazon not exist anymore
title: “Taking over”

content:
I purchased an incorrect item back in Nov 2018. Upon opening the package, I realized my mistake. I immediately applied for a refund, got my refund code, prepared the package to be sent back, and paid for the shipping back to the seller.

I contacted Amazon in mid-December after I realized the package had been delivered but my refund had not been received. They told me it could take some time and that they would take care of everything. I left it at that.

I had not received anything nor heard from Amazon into early January, so I contacted them again. I got the same response but they were escalating it to their complaints department. Great?!?! now I had to wait for them to get back to me again.

I had not received any communication since contacting Amazon earlier in the month. I was getting annoyed. I contacted them for the third time and I got the exact same run around that I was given earlier. I was given three days to hear back from Amazon to see if I can even get my refund.

It went from a simple return to the potential I won't even get it. Leaving the seller with both my money and the product. 

Every agent I spoke to had no information and no power. They couldn't do anything. Useless and a waste of time.

I have since deleted all my accounts
title: “Amazon doesnt care”

content: once again Amazon screws me and tells me that I have to correct everything. Ordered a camera to be delivered to an amazon pick-up box. Day of delivery, box is too big for amazon pick-up box, and apparently this is my fault not amazons, who sold the item, offered pick-up box as an option, and then refused delivery of item. Called the oh so not friendly amazon customer service just to be told the only thing they can do to transfer me to UPS so I can deal with it. Are you F'in kidding me. You screwed it up not me. It is your responsible to correct the issue, not me! requested to cancel order, customer service didn't cancel order. Called again the next day, basically the same thing. my fault, and I have to go and reorder etc. THIS IS NOT HOW BUSINESS FUNCTIONS. YOUR MISTAKE YOUR SOLUTION. I use to order a lot from amazon however their logical and customer service teams are terrible and have no empathy or basic customer service skill to correct their OWN MISTAKES. Don't Worry, I have been and will continue to take my business else where to businesses that actually want my business and make correct steps when they screw up.
title: “Worst Customer Service EVER”

content: I cant even begin to tell you how bad this company is to a customer since 2010. I will be writing a full review soon.
title: “Business Manger”

content: Save your money and buy directly from the seller and skip Amazon all together! Very poor customer service.
title: “Save your money”

content:
In my opinion the biggest difference between eBay and Amazon is that with eBay you can tell the "truth" about your experience in their feedback system. 

With Amazon whenever you tell the truth this is what you get. 

"Thank you for submitting a customer review on Amazon. After carefully reviewing your submission, your review could not be posted to the website. While we appreciate your time and comments, reviews must adhere to the following guidelines." 

So to me Amazon is a complete farce and they hide behind their lies, so that they look better!
title: “Not allowed to tell the truth!”

content:
Tuscom ships from china but does say so in ad. After you complain about late shipment THEN they tell you. Will take OVER four WEEKS to arrive (if it ever does). Also very unresponsive to information requests! 

Tell you not to accept shipment(ever try to not accept a shipment when you have no idea of when it's scheduled to arrive) and when (if) they receive it back in china, they will issue a credit. Total process wound probably take 3 or 4 months.

Amazon should ban this type of false advertising but they have done absolutely nothing. Only thing they have done is lost a very good customer.
title: “FALSE ADVERTISNG - TUSCOM”

content:
Amazon use to be the cheapest 
and I have used heavily that past several years but this last year 
things changed and they are getting greedy now and are no longer the 
cheapest from several different perspectives! Just comparing the base 
price I have been finding more and more to not be cheapest, then add 
shipping. Free 2 day with Prime that now costs $119 instead of $60 like 
it use to and this does not include free shipping on returns! That is 
another funny thing, free 2-day shipping selected but finding more and 
more it is not here in 2 days or sometimes even a week? My word ... so 
much $ was lost on Christmas presents this year just for paying the 
return shipping costs.lol, a $16.99 toy that the box is 6"x6"x2" and 
weighs almost nothings costs $6.99 to return?  A $70 Weighted blanket 
cost $29 to return .... NEVER again will I use Amazon for Christmas or 
gifts or rally anything I am not 99.9% it will not be returned! For 
gifts I am going back to physical stores like Kohl's where can shop 
online but the item can be returned directly without shipping costs.
title: “Loved Amazon for many years pre 2018, they getting greedy now!”

content:
Amazon is a thief just like their sellers, and worse, they endorse their thief's


            My worst shopping experience ever and I'm 82, and it was/is 
at Amazon.com. They are as big a thief as their sellers. They and the 
seller ripped me off for over $708.61, about 140.00 more! It was a 
Huawei P20 Pro cell phone that I never got. And they: Amazon.com  and 
New And Mint Condition Collectibles Attn: Ronen Gold, 400 W. Belmont, 
Chicago, IL committed a case of fraud against me.Chase Bank/Amazon/Amazon CC									12/21/2018Attn: Customer Service Ref: Bonneville County Sheriffs Case # 201840833Ref: Claim ID: C-20181005-5465, Ref. CC 8636								To Whom It May Concern:The
 above claim with you has been turned into the Bonneville County 
Sheriff's Office and is case File Nr. 2018-40833 and is being handled by
 Sergeant J. Martin at 208-529-1375. The FBI has also been notified and 
may also become involved as well since this case involved three or more 
states and many more people as well, maybe hundreds. This operation has 
been going on for some time and continues to this day with new fraud 
cases being added every day by the crooked sellers under the umbrella 
provided by Amazon.com which allows them to operate with impunity, and 
rip off Americans every day for hundreds and thousands of dollars and 
Amazon and Chase Bank also say it's not their responsibility. Chase
 has not retrieved all my funds from Amazon and Amazon has made no 
attempt to refund my funds. They have given me about a dozen different 
excuses, all different, all meaning nothing. Everyone says something 
different than the last person, adding up to nothing being done. Some of
 the excuses they used were: You filed the claim too early, also too 
late; I changed the dynamics of the order, I haven't returned the phone,
 the case has been closed, we're waiting for the seller to respond, you 
have to write to the seller, you are owed a refund, we'll send you 
$200.00 a week, we put $100.00 into your account for your problems 
(Sierra), I put $50.00 into your account for your problems, (Stephan),  
and no money was deposited into my account.The seller: New and 
Mint Collectables located at 400 W. Division, Chicago, IL has a long 
history of fraud on the internet which continues today and tomorrow. 
Amazon is protecting them from repaying or delivering the products 
promised to the buyers. There are many examples of this on Amazon's 
website under the seller's companies name which is owned by Ronen Gold, 
at 400 W. Division, Chicago, ILThe sad performance of Amazon (Dec.11th/18)                      						                 12/11/18In
 all my years, 82, never had I ever had such a bad shopping experience 
as with you; the crooked seller you allowed to operate under your 
umbrella for so long, and your staff who tried to mislead me, lied to me
 so many times and didn't do their jobs properly. I'm talking about my 
experience in buying a Huawei P20 Pro cell phone from your seller, who 
was/is a thief and sent me a piece of  junk phone for my $709.00; 
Newandmintcollectibles.com in Chicago. The way your staff handles 
problems like this is deplorable, and shouldn't be handled like it is. 
You treat the buyer like he's the thief, and give the thief so much 
leeway that he can get and do just about anything he wants without any 
repercussions. YOU APPARENTLY DON'T PAY ANY ATTENTION TO YOUR SELLERS 
RATINGS LIKE A NEGATIVE -88% WHEN IT SHOULD BE A +90 PERCENT BUSINESS 
RATING. And now I see you can't even find a trace of him on your site, 
but you're a little late, it appears he's already made off with the 
money and you expect me to absorb the loss, and you have no penalty. 
Then you have the audacity to have someone send me an email stating:Hello,
 We have closed your claim for order 112-1737567-3637863 because we have
 no evidence that the seller received your return. The seller has not 
received the return, and the information you provided does not prove 
that the package was delivered to the seller. As a result, this order is
 not eligible for the A-to-z Guarantee. If you need to return an item in
 the future, we recommend following these best practices to be sure that
 the seller receives your package: -- Include the order number on or 
inside the package. -- Insure the package. -- Use a signature 
confirmation delivery service. To learn more about coverage, visit our A-to-z Guarantee Help page on our Amazon.com site .amazon.c/a-to-z-guarantee.-- Date of Claim: November 23, 2018Sincerely,and
 there is no name on the message, so it makes it impossible for me to 
contact them. This whole thing would have never happened if you had a 
good IT man in your employment. I thought I was placing an order with 
FGS Trading, and because I changed the color of the phone from Black to 
Twilight, without my knowledge, it also changed the supplier to the con 
man that has been hiding under your umbrella for who knows how long and 
allowing him not to deliver a package or the wrong thing, as he has done
 in the past, and you allowed him to continue his fraud until he 
defrauded me out of $709.00 dollars. And you believe him and not me; 
that I returned the cheap piece of garbage to him. Well, there was a 
police officer here and he saw the package before I sent it out. And my 
postal guy will remember the package going out as well, I made sure of 
that. I also made a report to our sheriff and to the Chicago police as 
well. And maybe they'll find him even though he used a false address in 
Chicago. I'm sure they'll find him at the end of the trail which he'll 
leave behind. And you still owe me the amount mentioned above, because 
even some of your staff has told me I did everything correctly, and 
should have received my money back, as you state in all your little 
regulations that also say I should have received my money back in 7 to 
10 days and haven't. Are you that greedy?SincerelyJerry SinkovecP.S. Beware  of Amazon and their sellers!

content: I purchased an item by mistake and tried to cancel it right away.  The next day I got an email saying it was already shipped and it could not be cancelled. Really??? I cancelled it right  away!  Once I received the package, I returned it that day.  Even though this Asian company confirmed the return, I still as of this day have not received a penny. That was in July 2018. Amazon says they contacted the seller, the seller says they are looking into it.  Its the same thing over and over again with no results.  This has been going on for almost 6 months.  I urge everyone to be careful of where there item is coming from and check their background and rating.  I've been am Amazon customer for years with a Prime membership.  I will no longer buy anything from Amazon again for fear of being ripped off again.
title: “I've got ripped off!”

content:
After I wrote this review I got another message from Amazon.  I had 
order a tip that I liked and it came from one of the companies that 
sells through Amazon.  I was given an arrive date and then date came but
 the top didn't.  Ups handed off the package to USPS and the top never 
made it to me.  It got delivered to someone else and my money would be 
refunded.  Of course I got asked for a review on the product.  You know 
how did it fit, was I happy with it, things like that.  I responded.  
How the heck do I know any of the things you asked when the product 
never made it me.  It literally got lost in the mail.  They didn't like 
that comment and told me that it wouldn't be posted.
title: “Something I Ordered”

content:
My Amazon account was hacked and Amazon closed my account but they also have not allowed access to my over $11,000 in video and audio licensing (movies, audio, and kindle books) in my new account. They said this is their policy.

I am SHOCKED at their audacity in just stealing over $11,000 from me and my family. 

SHAME ON YOU AMAZON.
title: “Amazon policy is criminal, really it is criminal”

content: Wish we could give negative.I will never buy anything from amazon.com for christmas gifts.They treat non prime members like dirt.In fact I try to avoid them when I can because they have become a nightmare.I have learned my lesson.On their website they clearly and it really big bold type state that our orders will make it in time for christmas.Customer service literally denies the reality everyone else lives in about the delivery of christmas gifts.We expected the package in a reasonable 5-7 business days after ordering but because they live on another planet they waited over 5 days to ship it and now will be here several days after christmas.Wow,that's how much they care about their customers,their families and their christmas holiday.They also will not provide proper tracking for packages so don't expect to be able to track your package.Amazon has really fallen.
title: “Once awesome amazon is now a complete nightmare”

content: Not going to make this review long. Items have come damaged (more than several). Items not received within the time that they were promised. Items that were pre-ordered never showed up and were canceled. Packages being left on my garbage can. Everything is in Chinese or Chinese sold. Done with Amazon.
title: “Disappointed all the way”

content: 2 months and no refund back to me. The dress i bought very big. Amazon dont help me at all. The seller blocked me, i am so upset
title: “No refund”

content: I got so tired of so many e-mails stating that my order had arrived when I didn't order anything.  I didn't want to crack their eggs, do a survey, or anything else.  I tried to stop the e-mails from coming, tried each and everything they told me to do, but e-mails keep coming.  I had to go into their chat to get this address to cancel my account:  https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/rsvp-mi.html?q=acc1  They stopped me from posting on FB.  Isn't it great how such a huge company can't take a few bad comments?  I doubt I will ever do business with them again.

content:
I have been a huge Amazon fan for years... Prime member for years.... almost all on-line shopping dine through Amazon. I have relied heavily on their customer reviews because I felt that they were an HONEST evaluation of a given product. I discovered this week that their reviews are a LIE. They CENSOR and BLOCK negative reviews of verified purchases. This is OUTRAGEOUS. I am shocked and dismayed and wish there was some way I could tell the public at large that AMAZON REVIEWS ARE A SCAM. They will block negative reviews so that people will continue to waste their money on junk products. 

Here is the story and the proof. 

I purchased a stupid Christmas beanie cap on one of their Black Friday lightning deals. It was only like $6 or $7.  The fabric has Christmas lights around it and they supposedly lit up. I thought my high school daughter would get a kick out of it. Despite being Prime, it took like a week to arrive (their "2 day guaranteed free shipping is another scam which has frustrated me, but not like this... not enough to make me quit the convenience of Amazon). It shows up yesterday and I pull it out of the package and discover that - not only does it NOT light up, it has zero wires and no battery pack. There is a small pocket sewn in the inside where the battery and switch are supposed to be, but again, there are no wires and no battery. It was cheap and I didn't really care enough to return it, but I went onto website to leave a review. (I will generally leave reviews on products that are either 5-star fantastic, or 1-star terrible. I think those experiences are most valuable to other shoppers.) I went into my account and started my review by clicking the one-star button. This should have allowed my to then title and explain my poor review. Instead, I git a message saying that Amazon could not accept my review if this product (mind you, all I had done was click the one star button.) They said that they had some unusual review activity' so they were blocking reviews of this product. I went back into the product image and lo and behold, I see the questions and comments part, I discover that multiple customers received hats just like me. No wires. No battery. And they were also very upset that Amazon was not allowing them to review it. So I sent Customer Service an email expressing my dismay at them blocking honest reviews of products by verified customers on their website. It took a full day (not the 12 hours promised) to reply, but this was the response:

Hello Stacey

This is Deleon from Communities.

We couldn't accept your review for Windy City Novelties LED Light-up Knitted Ugly Sweater Holiday Xmas Christmas Beanie - 3 Flashing Modes (FA La La Beanie) because we detected unusual review behavior on this product.  We place limits on reviews to preserve trust in customer reviews.  This can include limiting submission of all reviews or limiting reviews to Amazon Verified Purchase reviews.  

For more details, please see our Community Guidelines:

http://www.amazon.com/review-guidelines/

For more information about Verified Purchase reviews:

https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?nodeId=201145140

We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Best regards,
Deleon A
........................................................................................................................

Thank you for your inquiry. Did I solve your problem?

If yes, please click here: 
http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/survey?p=A1WFYVNMG7PB3M&k=hy&ref_=cscem_hmdyes_pt_1

If no, please click here: 
http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/survey?p=A1WFYVNMG7PB3M&k=hn&ref_=cscem_hmdno_pt_1

........................................................................................................................

Your feedback is helping us build Earth's Most Customer-Centric Company.

Thank you.
Amazon.com

---- Original Message: ----

---------------
12/01/18 17:18:07
Your Name: Stacey 
Order Id: 112-0724340-1805852
Selected Order Items: 
   Windy City Novelties LED Light-up Knitted Ugly Sweater Holiday Xmas Christmas Beanie - 3 Flashing Modes (FA La La Beanie) - 112-0724340-1805852
Comments:This "light up" hat came with zero wires and no battery pack. Looking at the customer questions/answers, this has happened to a lot of people who ordered this as one of your Black Friday deals. I went to leave a review and it says that Amazon cannot accept my review of this product. What?!!! You are deciding that customers cannot review a product if something you are selling is total garbage? It is not worth my time nor energy to return it but I wanted to be able to at least warn other customers about this product. I have always relied heavily on customer reviews and is why I have always been a fan of Amazon despite numerous frustrations with shipping expectations that you set but rarely meet. Now I know that your reviews are a fraud. You shut down reviews of products that do not even meet basic standards. This company should NOT be allowed to sell through Amazon AND you should allow every verified customer to review any and all products that they have purchased. Shame on you. I will likely quit Amaxon because of this and will post on a review website that you are sensoring and blocking negative reviews.
---------------

The bottom line is this: Amazon is a DISHONEST COMPANY who is censoring customers reviews to protect their bottom line. They want everyone to waste their money on this stupid garbage hat because it makes them money. They want us to believe that the reviews we read are real and are from verified' customers, but they don't tell you that it ya all a lie because they pick and choose which reviews to accept. It is really a disgrace. They were the first company to publish customer reviews in 1995 and now they have lost their way. SHAME on Amazon. I will miss the convenience of shipping with them but I cannot support such a loathsome, dishonest company any longer. I hope all who read this will boycott Amazon as well.
title: “They BLOCK negative reviews!! BEWARE!!”

content:
For months I've been trying to solve a billing dispute with Amazon and Chase (who does Amazon's billing).  Last April Amazon offered a free month's trial of Amazon Prime shipping and I agreed to give it a try.  During that month I realized that I don't order from Amazon enough to justify paying them $14.00 a month so I called them to cancel my membership.  I also brought up the fact that they were charging me $7.99 a month for "Amazon Digital Services" (whatever the heck that is) and I certainly didn't order it.  I was assured that they'd cancel my subscriptions and credit my account.  They finally canceled the charges on my September statement but they added them back in the same statement!  They had been charging me the $21.99 per month for five months and it ended up they didn't actually credit my account for even one!
Every single time I've called, I've received the run around.  Amazon's Customer Service Reps (five of them!) tell me I have to call Chase and Chase tells me I have to contact Amazon!  An Amazon CSR sent me an email stating that I owe them nothing but Chase refused to give me their fax number or an email address that I could forward the email to.  After an Amazon Rep pulled a "we can't call Chase for you" runaround yet again I replied that Chase has refused several times when I suggested they set up a conference call between them, me and Amazon, he stated that they weren't allowed to make conference calls either. I pointed out that (1) Amazon is the one who notifies Chase how much to bill me for and (2) he knows as well as I do that Chase is not going to take a customer's word for anything...it had to come from Amazon.  I argued him down so he staged the conference call.  When we got a Chase CSR by the name of Rajesh (ID # L348143) on the line, he asked me to verify my identity.  He asked me my email address and I gave it to him.  He said my answer was incorrect so, even though I doubted that since I gave him the one they send their emails to, I held back my anger and gave him my old email address.  He again told me it was incorrect so he couldn't help me.  While he was talking I signed  into my Chase account, went to my profile page and sure enough, I gave him the correct address the first time.  When I informed him that I was starring at my profile page and I had given him the correct email address, he denied it.  When I asked  the Amazon CSR (who had been silent throughout the exchange) to verify my identity, the Chase Rep realized  he was a party to a conference call and he hung up on me.
That's how ridiculous this whole mess has gotten.  I called Amazon one last time this morning and spoke with Shahrukh (ID # I370786) and explained that my cancer meds cause memory loss and confusion and that's why I simply glanced at their statements and paid them whatever they said I owed.  But it finally hit me that the last things I ordered were a microwave in February, 2018 and 2 very cheap software discs in March and since I'd paid them $40 to $60 every month, they had to be paid off by then.  His solution was to credit my account for the two late charges that have been levied while I've been trying to settle the dispute. I told him that wasn't good enough because I'm not paying them another cent...in fact, they OWE ME $50.97.
I'm going to report both companies to the FTC and the BBB and when it's settled, I will cancel my Amazon account and, believe me, I will tell everyone I know or meet about this experience.
title: “Is it fraud, stupidity or incompetence?”

content:
Hello,
Wanted to bring something to light that just happened to me when purchasing a high dollar scope from Amazon.com. I just purchased a Steiner T5Xi from Amazon the seller, not a 3rd party seller (want to be sure that is clear that this came direct from Amazon as the merchant) and when I received the package today I received a shrink wrapped sealed T5Xi box with a Steiner seals on both sides of the box underneath the shrink-wrap. However, all I actually received in the original box were 2 freakin Ice Mountain water bottles inside! I almost got sick. 

Someone tried very hard to defraud either Amazon if it came from Steiner this way or an Amazon employee stealing and knowingly sending the package out this way. It had the LPN label on the outside of the box which usually indicates a previous customer return at some point which means, they were trying to pass it off as "New."

What strikes me as very odd was that the manufacture stickers were still sealing the box inside the shrinkwrap. I cut them both myself. That, and the fact that whoever did this knew the weight of the scope to get almost exactly the same weight with the 2 water bottles. 

I'm just in complete shock and awe. I've had someone try to rip me off before on eBay trying to say I sent them junk in a box. Thankfully, I record every package I send prior to shipping so I have the process on file for just these instances but the fact that it came from a billion dollar retailer sealed in this manner just baffles me. 

I can attach some pictures of the box and seals and contents of the package. 

This is the 2nd purchase of a scope in 1 week that was received as the wrong item. I also ordered a 3-12x44mm scope, again from Amazon the merchant, not a 3rd party merchant, and what I received was the same model but the 4-18x44mm version INSIDE the 3-12x44mm box. So obviously, they are selling used or returned items as "New" and their now $15 p/h employees are not even checking the boxes to verify the contents.

I am done purchasing anything from Amazon, period. They are clearly falsely marking items as "New" that are previously used or returned items and the folks in charge of checking these things to ensure that they are returned correctly and properly retested are failing miserably. 

Thanks for your attention,
William Burnett
title: “Too Much Fraud Allowed & Misrepresenting "New" used items”

content: My hobby is building AK-47s.  They are immaculate but sometimes when looking for parts I try and find a reasonable bargain. I usually add scopes to them and almost always buy from a military supplier in Belarus...a small country just west of Russia. I sometimes find good scopes on Ebay but I never knew that Amazon sold the Belarus scopes until recently.  Amazon had a model scope I like and usually buy but I had never bought one from Amazon. These were cheaper than normal but since the wording was incorrect and some of the specifications displayed incorrectly I at first thought that who ever listed the article just was ill-informed and perhaps mismatched the prices. After all there were some of the correct scopes with the normal prices listed next to the scope I was interested in. Over the next hour I looked closely and the item had the Belarus markings in Ukrainian. The title had Russian terms. The scope was exactly the same as the ones shown on the Belarus site in every detail. I thought to myself that surely Amazon would not allow imitations and knock-offs to be sold on their site? So I bought the scope. The next morning I got an "Your item has shipped" with a Chinese post tracking number. The delivery date spanned two weeks which was a good indicator it was coming from China. I found out that  indeed the scope I bought was a Chinese imitation. I tried to write a review of my experience but Amazon rejected it saying I could not say it was an imitation and of poor quality. The next morning I noticed the price went up $40. I noticed these scopes were intermingled among authentic scopes but there is no indicator that these scopes are mailed from China which would be the one key warning that all was not right.  I have a whole new opinion of Amazon and their business practices.
title: “On the edge of a scam !”

content:
Amazons service has gone downhill and I have grown unhappy with them with my last order. 
Evenflo Pivot Xpand Modular Travel System, Stallion https://www.amazon.com/dp/B077Y967XC/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_ciEJBbFXPFZ0B
I ordered this stroller on August 17th. A week and a half later on Tuesday August 28th, the stroller was STILL not shipped out. I called amazon and I was assured that it would be shipped out soon and arrive by the 30th since it was a gift for a baby shower i have to TODAY (Sept 1st) Well guess what? The stroller was shipped out on THURSDAY and it's not here! I now have to go to the baby shower empty handed because Amazon took over TWO WEEKS to ship out the stroller! I have NEVER had service like this with amazon ever. Amazon used to be so great with their prompt service (I do not have prime) if I ordered something two weeks prior. Amazon also screwed up and sent me my items (of the same order) in a plain brown box without the amazon logo box that products always arrive in and I was missing two items! When I called amazon AGAIN I'm getting one of the items shipped to me at no extra charge, and the other item they wanted returned. How am I supposed to return something I never got? When I spoke to customer service, the woman I spoke with wasn't very apologetic, she was rather rude and tried to give me an amazon gift card so I could repurchase the item. I said no and to put it back on my credit card. That I would not be purchasing from amazon again. All I've had was headaches the past two weeks in dealing with them. I could have gone to Target, and paid the SAME price ($400) for the stroller and had it already and would have been prepared for my baby shower that I need to go today. Thank you amazon for ruining my gift for the baby shower. I should get the $7 dollar refund that the stroller is now up for "sale" with for my troubles. After speaking with amazon about my troubles they REFUSED to give me the $7 back for my troubles and ended up giving me line after line of bull$#*! of why they couldn't give me a credit of $7. 
They also deleted my review of the "stroller" (which was titled appropriately "this is a review of amazon not the stroller") because it did not meet their "guidelines", it doesn't meet their guidelines because I was speaking badly about amazon and god forbid they have any negative comments floating around, my god they might lose business. 
And guess what? THEY ARE! 
The stroller is now down to $385, $14 lower than the original price I paid.

content:
Amazon customer service representatives lies.  I had 2 orders from them and they lied about shipping.  The first order was a birthday gift, the customer service said they have notified UPS to deliver it by the birthday date.  It did not happen, and the package was delivered 3 days after the birthday.

My most recent purchase was a mobile phone worth $1000.  I scheduled the delivery one week after because no one will be home to receive it.  I was surprised that they changed it to 2 day shipping.  So, I called UPS and UPS told me to talk to Amazon to change the date.  I chat with Amazon 3x and all 3 representatives assured me that it will arrive on my expected date and not the date that I was seeing on the tracking.  Representatives said that UPS will not leave it outside if no one is at home and that they already notified UPS.  When I saw the tracking saying out for delivery, I immediately contacted Amazon for a 4th time.  Representative told me again not to worry, that UPS just put it in the truck but it won't be delivered and that UPS will not leave it outside.  Guess what?!  UPS left it outside the house.  Amazon will say ANYTHING to assure a customer, but I doubt they even talked to UPS on the phone to make sure it really will be delivered on the date I wanted.  

So, I chat with Amazon 2 more times after that and told them to send UPS back to pick the package for return to Amazon and issue me a full refund.  Amazon rep is stupid to ask if I can send someone to check if the package is still there. If I had someone to check it, then I would ask that person to take it until i can get it.  Amazon rep are so stupid.  Anyway, I told them it is exactly wherever the UPS put it because no one is at home.  They gave a tracking number.  As of right now. no one has picked it up.  Good thing I can always ask my credit card company to dispute it.
title: “Amazon representatives Lies about shipping”

content: I ordered a pack of eye drop bottles and I received a message from Amazon telling me that the carrier they use, which is APEC require that I provide my citizen ID and my Chinese name!! Then on the same day I received another message from ECMS which says that it is a logistics provider  saying that this is required by Customs in China. I don't understand why I need to provide my personal ID for buying just some eye drop bottles and why my Chinese name is required. I have ordered goods from Amazon quite a few times and this has never happened before. This is an infringement on my privacy. I am not going to provide them. Unless Amazon changes this, I will stop buying on an Amazon.com.
title: “Terrible requirement for clearing customs”

content:
Recently, I was in the market for some new R-12 hoses to refurbish an older AC gauge set when I happened on an advertisement from Amazon featuring all three replacement hoses for about $17+ bucks. It seemed like a good deal except for the long delay in shipping the goods but I wasn't in any hurry so I thought I'd sign up.

Unfortunately, I quickly discovered that Amazon.com doesn't allow guest purchases' as does EBAY, it's members only' at Amazon and your order is conditional upon membership acceptance. I received the following confirmation memo Jan 16, sent to me at our sites email address.

 Order Confirmation

 Hello Allen Williams, 

Thank you for shopping with us. You ordered "Atoplee 3pcs (2500~500)PSI...". We'll send a confirmation when your item ships. 

  Details Order #105-5734003-9497812

Arriving:

Monday, February 6 - 

Tuesday, February 28 

Amazon.com

This was the typical automated response however, the next day I received a follow-up email which I expected to be an actual ship date but instead my account' was frozen!

Subject: Re: Your Amazon.com order cannot be shipped On 1/16/ 12:24 PM, address-verification@amazon.com wrote: There was a problem processing your order. You will not be able to access your account or place orders with us until we confirm your information.

You can help us resolve this issue by replying to this message with the billing name, address, and phone number registered to your card. Please reply from the email address registered to your Amazon.com account.

 If needed, update your information with the card issuer. 

For your security, we restrict access to your billing details to a team of account specialists. Our Customer Service team cannot access these details or provide you with more information on this issue. They can only verify that we sent this request.

We ask that you not open new accounts as any order you place may be delayed.

Amazon.com

This makes no sense unless the real purpose of being an Amazon member is to open all of your transactions to government phishers. All the personal 'verification' needed was to PING the card in amount of $1.00 to confirm its validity otherwise the card would be rejected outright. What Amazon is really saying here is that we don't trust you to be who you claim to be without outside confirmation. That's not membership, it's just abuse.

Apparently Amazon no longer limits abuse to its employees but is now including customers as Salon reports: Worse than Wal-Mart: Amazon's sick brutality and secret history of ruthlessly intimidating workers. (https://www.salon.com/2014/02/23/worse_than_wal_mart_amazons_sick_brutality_and_secret_history_of_ruthlessly_intimidating_workers/)  "You might find your Prime membership morally indefensible after reading these stories about worker mistreatment." Don't be overly shocked, this is simply globalism and its New World Order business practices. It's the future of American business. Oh that's just sour grapes. Really? Well how about Amazon used neo-Nazi' guards to control workers in German factory? 
(https://www.rt.com/news/amazon-abuse-staff-germany-310/) Oh, too harsh, still? How about the Orwellian work environment at Amazon as in Forbes' assessment, "What Amazon's Work Culture Tells Us About Employee Disengagement (https://www.forbes.com/sites/causeintegration/2015/08/21/what-amazons-work-culture-tells-us-about-employee-disengagement/#6316bac454f0)

But what disturbs me most is the Huff Post Blog reporting a $600 million dollar deal Amazon struck with the CIA for cloud services  (https://www.huffingtonpost.com/norman-solomon/why-amazons-collaboration_b_4824854.html) which likely means the CIA has access to all purchases made by Amazon customers. The Blog further reports: ".. a signer in Cincinnati wrote: "If Amazon chooses to sell out their customers to the CIA, I will never visit their site again. Betrayal shouldn't be the price of convenience." This certainly goes a long way towards explaining why Amazon would be so interested in confirming' mine and others customer information.

On Jan 17th, I called the company and spoke to a representative who was to look into the problem.' I told them what had happened and the lady I spoke with indicated that I had to respond with the email address that I opened the account with. Well, duh.. I DID that and they acknowledged it by responding to the ORIGINAL email address that I opened the account with!!. (Actually, I responded with both my email addresses and still received the same mind numbing response.)

Hello,

We encountered an issue with your account, and have removed your access to this account because the card issuer has refused to confirm your name and billing 
address for your Visa ending in 56. You will not be able to access your account or place orders with us until we verify your information.

To resolve this issue, please allow the card issuer to grant our request, or send the information below to our secure fax line:

-- A copy of your statement for the payment card used, including the billing address
-- The last two digits of the payment card
-- Your name, phone number, and email address  
You can find our fax number on the Amazon.com Help page:  ttps://www.amazon.com/help/addressverification

We will convert your fax to a secure electronic image.  To protect your information, we restrict access to your  billing details to a team of account specialists.

Our Customer Service team can confirm that we sent this email, but they cannot view your fax or share more information about this issue.

You can expect a response from us within 24 hours of sending your fax. If you would like us to confirm your information  with the card issuer, reply to this email after you have arranged for them to grant our request.

In the meantime, please do not open new accounts because any new order that you place may be delayed. We are sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused. 

Amazon.com

Yes, secure like Yahoo and Facebook which had millions of their 'secure' customer records hacked. And might they also be passing my business information along to the NSA or FBI as BEST Buy technical people are currently doing for the FBI? (https://www.zerohedge.com/news/2018-03-08/fbi-has-been-paying-geek-squad-spy-customers-over-decade)

The customer rep never addressed my reply or indicated why my bank had to confirm my identity. A few days later I got another email asking why I discontinued my account. Interesting enough, Amazon's Bezos owns the Washington Post and since I have been a written critic of that intellectual rag, the Amazon episode begins to make a bit more sense.

Trump may be on to something in Donald Trump's war on Jeff Bezos, Amazon and the Washington Post Looks like Amazon.com has been getting a pretty cushy tax break in their rise to economic fame. (http://money.cnn.com/2016/05/13/technology/donald-trump-jeff-bezos-amazon/)

And of course, we all know the journalistic integrity' of WAPO as in After the WaPost's Latest Shot, It's Time to Call Fake News' By Its Real Name Weaponized Journalism'  (http://thefreethoughtproject.com/wapost-fake-news-weaponized-journalism/) My observation to the WAPO editor on instructions from Jeff Bezos for their news coverage is that company policy (written or otherwise) dictates news coverage just as it would with any other firm subsidiary. Don't think for a moment that WAPO isn't looking out for the Amazon billionaire's interests.

There is another possibility, the company is advertising the sale of an item they don't have and won't have available unless a sufficient number of people express interest before they order from their China supplier. In that case you might want a verifiable customer base to motivate the Chinese.

If you're an Amazon customer get prepared for more invasive scrutiny of your account information, and if you're not, don't JOIN!.
title: “Amazon.com Abusive and Invasive Customer service”

content:
I've been with Amazon Prime at least 5 years, probably more like 7 or 8.  Today I was on the amazon.com site browsing when a little pop-up window solicits me, saying.... "download the amazon app and we will give you $10 off a $20 purchase"... I went ahead and clicked the link provided within the pop up ad. It downloaded the amazom app and I resumed browsing. After putting $20 of items in my cart( prime items), went to check out....and low and behold there was no $10 credit as advertised in the promotional pop up! I called customer service and after being on the phone for over a half hour and speaking to two different people I had no choice but to cancel my Prime Membership. WHY do I want to be with a company that doesn't stand by their own words!?!
They solicited me with an offer so I'm not really sure what's going through their heads right now...but apparently they need the $10 more than I do, bless  their little heart!

All I can say is if they dont want to honor their promotions maybe they shouldn't solicit people with little pop up windows ....

The funny thing is not only did I cancel my Prime membership (for which they will have to refund me 120...) but I will not be renewing it again in the future!!!

So they lost 120 this year and 100's in future years....

Overall this was more of a blessing in disguise... now I'm free!!!

 I won't have to pay 120 a year for free shipping that I use only a handful of times each year. Otherwise the only other service I was using was Amazon video... and between you and me it leaves a lot to be desired. Nothing that Netflix or Hulu cant do as well or better.
title: “Says 1 thing, does another”

I just want my boots!

Amazon has got to big and what is funny is Walmart is not capitalizing on Amazons fails.  I used to love Amazon, I am in the top 5K reviewers in the USA so I know what I am talking about. I still use Amazon, but more and more using Walmart,
title: “Too Big To Care, over run by junk and bad service/”

content:
I use to highly enjoy Amazon at first then it all became about Prime.  Less and less became accessible to clients unless they upgraded to a Prime account.  I ceased purchasing several items because they became Prime only members.  When I did try Prime I found you needed to make at least 10 purchases a year to make it worth while.  Other wise it's not really worth it.  I found they lie about the shipping dates all the time.  Especially during the holidays.  Starting around early October shipping is unreliable and they can barely keep up with the order volume.  

If an item becomes backordered your purchase sits until it comes in.  No way to cancel it.  This keeps happening to me.  Not one word of notification it was backordered just pending, pending and pending for weeks.  I had to call and ask.  They told me they could not cancel it.

Amazon use to be high quality items that would last a while and reasonably priced.  Now it's a China junk store with all the c*rappy merchandise you could want that's been sold to the cheapest bidder that will break after a few uses.  Amazon is not regulating the items they sell and the quality is just going down hill.

Customer service is also another issue.  Customer service is terrible.  If you get a gift card that does not work it's hell being on the phone for up to an hour or two just trying to get the dumb thing to work.  No point in going to the store you purchased it from because gift card booths are contracted out.  They're just selling the item they do not own it.  

I've also noticed Amazon reviews to be some what fluffed and most if not all are lies.  Every Amazon review I post seems to either be A) edited beyond what I originally wrote and is not even close to what I wrote. Hence plagiarism.  or B) Denied if it's the slightest bit negative that hints the product is defective or bad.

I am a price shopper and go with the highest quality item at the lowest bid.  Amazon over charges their clientele and I wonder just how long I have been over paying for things.  Most retailers on Amazon over charge their items any where from 15-25% all the way up to 50% marked-up compared to your local retailer.  

I use to be all about Amazon but around 2015 I noticed things changing any where from quality control to marked-up price inflation.  Amazon no more.  Local ma and pa business yes.
title: “Amazon NO More”

content: Amazon wonders why it has so much trouble with deliveries--it's the idiots they hire to deliver the packages. I have a covered front porch which is protected from the street view. That's where USPS, UPS, and FedEX leave my packages. The A$$HAT who delivered my Amazon package today put it in my driveway in front of my garage door. If my neighbor hadn't noticed it, I would have driven right over it. Furthermore, it was in plain view the street and it was RAINING! So my package was soaked. I'm not ordering from Amazon ever again. There are other options where at least you'll get your packages. Every time my friend gets a package from Amazon she has to look all over her neighborhood for it. They won't come back to get it from the wrong house. She's found two of her packages, but the rest are still missing.

Again, instead of a package I recieved a notification that there was a delay and that it may arrive by Wednesday so I called again. This time I was assured the package would be delivered by mid day Monday, but again no package and another phone call. Now we are at a little over a week later and I have placed the same order for the 3rd time with a new "expected" delivery date of 2 more days - Wednesday. My advice, if it is an item you need or are expecting by a certain date don't order from Amazon and don't waste your money on a prime membership that worthless anyway!!!

content: I've only ordered a few things on Amazon but I've had several heinous experiences including the current one that I'm going to go to other suppliers. On Memorial Day, I had to choose between buying a mattress online or going to a local mattress store. I've asked elated and place an order through Amazon and then was going to change my mind but Amazon had already "shipped" the item. That's shorthand for took my money. The item was supposed to be here Thursday of last week and FedEx said it was on the truck ready to be delivered, but their driver drove right past and then lied and said nobody was in the apartment office or at home. There were three people in the office waiting for the delivery and one person at home waiting for the delivery. So we called FedEx and ask them if they could please deliver the item as they are contracted to and do their actual job. On Friday of course the same driver drove past we watched him drive past and refuse to stop again he entered into his terminal that nobody was there which is a complete fraudulent lie there were three people in the office and one or two people in the apartment. We called FedEx and they had no sympathy other than to say the driver had grossly made an error and other than that go screw yourself for using FedEx. I communicated with the mattress company on Amazon and they said my communications were inappropriate and that it would be there on Monday. Then I noticed that any negative review Amazon is deleted immediately.  I truly believe this is why one should not invest in Amazon stock I believe they are greed based, fraudulent, and ready for a crash. Why? The same exact thing happened on Christmas with Amazon, and other items I've ordered from Amazon have been stale and needed to be returned. I guess ordering from Amazon is like ordering from a really bad 99 Cent Store except you don't get to keep your product. Boycott.

title: “Worst CS of all time”

content: Been a sub-Prime member for years. First was $80 per year, then $100, now $120. But, free, "GUARANTEED 2 day delivery, on items that qualify, wow. You also get sub-Prime video, think of it as Netflix-lite-lite. Great video selection, not. My main gripe are the tactics used to purchase an item. Sub-Prime? Check. Free 2-day shipping? Check. Item Prime and in stock? Check. You are also told, "order within the next "count-down timer", and get "Guaranteed Delivery by "this" date. Here is where the problem starts. After purchase is made, you start getting messages that the item, items, will be coming later, and later and later. The only "GUARANTEE" is to expect this regularly. I contacted AMAZON to ask what the "GUARANTEE" means. Was told, "We are sorry for your experience and will extend your Sub-Prime membership another month for free". Wow. Thats like getting food poisoning at a restaurant and the owner offers you a doggy-bag of same food for your troubles. Amazon employs used car salesman tactics and time sensative pressure to make you purchase an item. Once they have your money. They laugh all the way to the bank. You will get your item whenever they feel like it. I suggest this. DO NOT pay for useless Sub-Prime membership. Pay for 2 day shipping per item, if supplier offers it and cannot meet requirements, Amazon will refund your shipping cost. So, either you get it on time, or shipping is free. And you dont pay $120 a year for nothing. I also verified the refund thru Amazon, but not if your Sub-Prime. It's a shame the consumer takes the brunt of a company that has grown too big and takes advantage of its customers. Amazon used to be good, not anymore.
title: “Yes sir, may I have another?”

This big company doesn't have a heart, the item was return I did not make money yet they have a nerve to charge.  They said it's all standard fees, I didn't know that but now I know it's all fees.  They don't care.

content: I liked a watch on amazon.com and i decided to buy it. amazon offered to me to pay with my local currency with is Egyptian pounds, i agreed. i made the purchase and received on my mobile phone a message from bank stating the amount has been deducted. i checked my online account and everything is great. a week later i found on my account that amazon has deducted another higher amount for the same purchase. i called my bank and i found out that amazon withheld the original amount in my account and deducted another higher amount for same purchased item. i asked the bank to refuse to pay. i emailed amazon since i can't reach them by phone and asked to explain why the discrepancies, to my shock they have no trace of the second amount being deducted, they can't prove it exist and they want to me send them a photo of my bank account showing the charge which i refuse because its not safe doing so. a couple of days later amazon emailed me saying that my bank refuse to pay for the purchased item , i explained to them that there is double charge but to no avail, the second charge doesn't exist on their computers and they asked me to accept another recharge for the same original amount, i said that make thrice the charge for same item. i let the bank deal with them removed by credit cards from my account just to be safe.my bank released the withheld amount to my account. amazon refund me shipping cost. check your bank account online when you make an online purchase to know what go withhold and what got charged.
title: “Amazon prices with Egyptian pounds”

content:
Chris's Bargains Is an Amazon seller. But they do NOT have anything to sell. NO INVENTORY!! They are dropshippers! They have NO books to sell. Like many of the Amazon drop shippers, they post ads for things on different websites. When someone buys something from them, they just turn around and look for something else on the web that's cheaper and have the real seller send it to their buyer. They are actually dropshippers that have been around for a long time. They were banned on Amazon, Amazon closed their account and they had to wait 3 months to set up a new account, which is why they appear to be new sellers. We're not sure, but based on the timing, we believe they may be the old seller "DailyDeals", whose scams got them shut down on Amazon. 

Chris's Bargains prices are outrageous, because of course as scammers they are just skimming money off the top. We're shocked people fall for the scam, but Amazon is doing nothing to stop it, since they are raking in fees when every book sells twice.

Just know, That like the rest of the dropshippers, if you buy a book from them or anything else, you are paying a lot more than you need to, and all they are going to do is by a cheaper book from another person that had it posted on Amazon and send it to you. You are paying to get scammed!
title: “They are DROP SHIPPERS.  Not real book dealers. They have NO books!”

content:
I Ordered the Sony (used) 900e through Amazon. I was given a guaranteed delivery date. Made arrangements to have someone home that day to sign for the delivery. The TV did not come on the promised day which caused much inconvenience. Finally, the package arrived. I removed the TV from the box, and much to my surprise, the entire screen was cracked. Upon closer examination I found a huge hole in the side of the box. The television had not been properly packed; there was nothing in the box to prevent screen damage. Needless to say, I immediately returned the product. It was a big mistake to purchase this item used!

Later on that evening, I went to Best Buy and purchased a new 990e for $115.00 more. I couldnt believe the extra measures that were taken in the packaging to insure that there would be no damage to the set.

Id also like to mention, that a set of new Dolby Atmos headphone were also ordered at the same time. What I received was a used set of headphones poorly packed with important parts missing.

This review was censored by Amazon. They will only accept reviews pertaining to the product any negativity about Amazon will not be posted. This is reason in itself to not do business with Amazon.
title: “Buyer beware”

content:
I placed an order for a cryptocurrency wallet on 13th March 2018. 

Immediately after that I received an Order Confirmation followed by another email informing me that my account has been blocked and my order cannot be processed unless I send them my billing name, address and phone number registered on my credit card. 

Since their email did not elaborate what the issue was but merely asked for information on my credit card, I had to make assumptions on the possible problems and responded with the details requested and explanations. 

More than a day later, in response, I get another email from amazon asking me to log in to my account and upload my credit card statement. 

However, since my account was blocked I was not able to log into my account and hence I could not upload the card statement either. I sent amazon a note on my predicament and at the same time thought I might as well speak to their customer service consultant to expedite the matter. After searching their website for more than 20 minutes I could find neither a chat link nor a telephone number to call. I gave up.  

Later in the night, it occurred to me that I could possibly find their customer service telephone number by googling it. I found it and called them only to get an answer that they will look into it and revert to me after a day or two! I have yet to hear from them.
title: “Extremely Poor Customer Service. It Really Sucks!”

content:
In relation to Order # 205-8187368-2071530:

On 18th December I placed an order with Amazon for around £250 worth of items using their Prime 'Guaranteed Next Day' delivery service. The order consisted 11 different items (a range of toys and other gifts bought for Christmas to give to family and friends). Amazon in the past have been a very reliable and reputable company with exemplary customer service so I felt that this was a convenient and safe option to make sure I had everything arrive in time for Christmas. This, however, was the start of my Christmas nightmare.

The following day, nothing arrived. This was not an issue however, as my family were not coming to visit until the following Saturday so there was still another 4 days left before it would present any sort of problem for me. On the Wednesday, 3 of the 11 items turned up. On Thursday, nothing. On Friday morning, I finally receive a phone call from my sister (whose address the parcels were due to arrive at) telling me she was starting to get worried as most of the items had still not arrived and they had to be ready and wrapped for the following day to give to my visiting family members who live in a different part of the country. Given the urgency of the situation, I decided to take a break from work and give Amazon's customer service department a call.

I initially spoke to a member of their team who looked into the situation and found that the items had indeed not been delivered, but that it should be fine and they would most likely arrive later that day. I explained my situation to them and told them that essentially if the items did not turn up I would be stuck with nothing to give to my family to open on Christmas day. I asked this member of staff to look into the situation again so that they could absolutely guarantee this, at which point the line goes quiet and a few seconds later the call terminates. Not being satisfied with the outcome, I decide to call back again at which point I get through to another customer service agent who again appears to hang up the call. By this point I was getting very frustrated but given that I had no choice I decided to call them again.

By this time, it was 3:00pm and I had already wasted around half an hour of my working day trying to sort the situation out. I then get through to customer service agent number 3, who I explain to that I haven't received my items - to which he replies that they will definitely arrive by 9pm that night. I then explain to the agent that I need this absolutely guaranteed as if they do not deliver the items by 9pm I would then not have an opportunity to go out Christmas shopping that day in order to replace the items they had not delivered. After some deliberation he agrees to go and double check for me, and, surprise surprise, he tells me that the parcels won't be arriving after all.

By this point, I was absolutely fuming. I could not believe that after 5 days of waiting on their 'Guaranteed Next Day' delivery and an hour on the phone speaking to 3 different people they were actually telling me they were not able to deliver my parcels. All of this given that they DIDN'T EVEN HAVE THE DECENCY to contact me and let me know what was going on. Had my sister not bothered to contact me, I wouldn't have even known until the following day (by which point it would be too late).

Anyway, I continued my conversation with agent number 3 and explained that I was absolutely disgusted by their level of service and that my only option was to finish work early (costing me around £50 in lost pay), travel to the town centre and spend the rest of my afternoon/evening shopping for presents that I didn't have the money for (since I had already spent it with Amazon). The initial response to this was to offer me a £5 Amazon gift card and 1 month free Amazon Prime (frankly an insult given the situation). They then offer me a refund to which I tell the agent it does not compensate me for the situation they have caused and I would be making a complaint and closing down my account (which I have had for over 10 years and spent many thousands of pounds with them on). He then decides to go and speak to his manager, and agrees that they will still fulfill the order and I will receive the items in due course, and they will issue me a full refund (which would instantly arrive in my account) for the items not yet received. Although I was not happy about having to leave work and roam around the town centre buying presents, I felt this was fair compensation and the best they could do given the situation. We then end the call and I head out of work.

I arrive in a very busy town centre and attempt to look for anything which may be suitable given the money I had on my card. I enter Toys R Us and grab some toys for my niece and nephew, head to the counter and get my card out to pay. I enter my PIN and find that my card has been declined. I then try again, but it appears as though there is no money in my account. I then leave Toys R Us (the time is now about 5:00pm) and head to the Cashpoint machine to find that my refund has not yet arrived. I go on Amazon's live chat and the person I speak to tells me that the refund will arrive in 5-7 working days. Desperate, I call one of my friends who agrees to lend me £50 (not exactly enough for 8 gifts but better than nothing). I then spend my evening around town buying anything I can so at least there is something for my family to open for Christmas (aware that the items should arrive later on and I could always try and post them later).

Christmas then comes and goes without too much bother. It comes to my attention in the first week of January however that the items had still not been delivered, so I decide its time to give Amazon another call. I get through to a customer service agent, and after saying a few words the call hangs up, so I call back again. I then get through to another agent who explains to me that my refund has been issued. I tell him that I have received the refund but I was still waiting for the items, for which he says the items had been returned and would not be sent out again. I then explain to them that I was still supposed to receive the items as per the agreement I made with them on the 22nd of December, to which he replies (surprise) that there are no notes on the system to this effect. He agrees to raise the issue with a manager for it to be investigated and I would definitely receive an email back about this in 5-7 days.

2 weeks later, I still have no email or items, so I call Amazon again. After calling them three times and being hung up on and spending around 45 minutes on the phone I am finally put through to a supervisor. They tell me again that there is no notes on the system and there has been no investigation into my case. This time, I am promised a call back the following day at 5:00pm once the investigation has been done. I sit next to my phone at 5:00pm the following day but do not receive a call. I then check my Amazon account to find a message sent saying that they 'weren't able to reach me' and they were sorry that I was 'misinformed' that I would still receive the items. They tell me I should call back again for more information about it.

I can tell you I have now given up trying to deal with their shambolic customer service team. The entire experience has been absolutely disgraceful and they should be ashamed of the way they have treated me as a longstanding and loyal customer of 10 years. I am now going to be closing my account with them and I will be posting my experience on every major review site online as well as telling all my friends and family. Amazon has embarrassed me at a supposed happy time of year and they don't seem to give a monkeys about their customers anymore. I will now be reporting them to the Advertising Standards Agency regarding their false advertising claims and I will be speaking to BBC's Watchdog about my case.

I HAVE FULL EVIDENCE FOR ALL OF THIS BUT IF ANYONE ELSE HAS HAD A SIMILAR EXPERIENCE PLEASE LET ME KNOW AS WE CAN POTENTIALLY WORK TOGETHER IN HOLDING AMAZON TO ACCOUNT ON THEIR FALSE CLAIMS AND POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE.
title: “AMAZON RUINED MY CHRISTMAS - DO NOT TRUST AMAZON PRIME OR THEIR USELESS CUSTOMER SERVICE!”

content:
I purchased an Amazon Echo in the US to use in Canada.  I originally used a US address to set it up and always wanted it to be based in Canada.  I was delighted when Amazon announced the Echo would be available in Canada.  I changed the address easily and all was good until I wanted to add a skill.  When I tried to add the skill it told me my language need to be set to Canadian English.  I went into the setting and Canadian English was not available.  

I called Amazon and after being passed to 5 people, I was told it had to be resolved by Amazon Canada and someone would get back to me.  They never did, but all of a sudden Canadian English could be selected but could not be saved to the Echo.  I again phoned Amazon, and after trying to get me to do the same things I had already done I was told that was just too bad, it was a US device and would only work in the US, even though the language selection was there it just would not save to the device. I spoke to a supervisor (Chase) and he said he would put in a problem report, but I have no reference or timeframe.  So a big International company like Amazon has a fundamental problem like not being able to save language preferences and it seems it is just too bad,

In the end they just want you to go away or buy a new device.  The customer service is just bad,
title: “Amazon Echo, 1st generation, can not set language for skills”
