content:
I recently called Amazon to request a refund of fees for a service for which I'd not contracted. Amazon's very cheery customer service assured me it was no problem. I then explained that I no longer used the credit card to which the fee was being charged, so could they refund it to my bank account or  to another card? 

As these words were issuing from my mouth, the happy-go-lucky customer service representative sent the refund to the card I no longer used. When I asked why he did not allow me to explain what I needed, he became less cheery.

Needless to say, the credit card company where I no longer had an account had little time for my request to resend the funds to Amazon -- and who can blame them?

A second email to Amazon produced a boilerplate response. You get a prepared message that has some peripheral relationship to your request, and it tells you to look at the FAQ or something like that. 

A reply to this produced a response from a representative who seemed capable of logical reasoning. His reply, however, was grim: He explained that Amazon could do nothing, unless maybe the funds came back, and maybe not even then. 

It is somewhat amazing: Amazon is reputed to have the best customer service in the world, but it appears to be fraying at the edges. Too many bots, and not enough representatives? Or is there little difference these days at this company? I recommend you to take great care with your dealings with this mastodontic mess.
title: “Refund wreck”

content:
I signed up for Amazon's Prime Membership trial. There was no fine print during the sign-up saying that I was actually subscribing to the full membership. There was no disclaimer saying that I had to cancel my subscription (not trial sign-up like it was advertised) if I did not want to pay $90 for something that I was not sure if I wanted or not. I was not hooked on Prime during the trial and so I did not subscribe to it afterward....... thinking that was the process.........

So... when the trial ended, Amazon automatically TOOK $90 from my credit card WITHOUT my knowledge. As far as I'm concerned, this company is shady and disreputable.

I'm not using any Amazon products or services again and will be sure to pass along what I've learned to family and friends.
title: “Prime Trial had NO disclaimer that I was subscribing, not just signing up for a trial...... Lost $90”

content: I just called Amazon about an issue w/ an order that I placed on 12/18/2017 to be delivered before Christmas, I went on their site to track my orders and one of the orders and it showed no order submitted int he last 6 months.  I requested a call from customer service, there was apparently an issue w/ my debit card, my bank issues a daily limit, which my order had exceeded. No problem, I asked the customer rep if I could give him my routing # and Bank acct # and he could withdraw the total.  He put me on hold and said he couldn't do it, it didn't work, I said how could you have tried it I haven't given you my bank info yet.  He tried to run my debit card again after I told him about the bank limit.  After trying to explain what I was asking again, I realized this moron doesn't know what I'm talking about.  I gave him a credit card, which took him about a 1/2 hour to figure out, I pull up my order while we're talking and it says 2 day delivery, guaranteed delivery by Tuesday, December 26th, meanwhile, today is Thursday, December 21, (2 days would be Saturday Dec. 23rd).  I brink this to the attention of the representative, I really want it delivered by Christmas...his solution is to cancel the order on his end and for me to go online and resubmit the order...are you fricken kidding me, I've just spend 45 minutes on the phone with this moron, telling him it's a Christmas present.  He can't change the delivery to overnight it on his end.  I ask to speak with his supervisor, I'm extremely uncomfortable at this point with anything he has to tell me.  He puts me on hold for a second and gets back on the phone and states that he's not going to put me on with a supervisor because he's one of the supervisors in his department. I've never wrote a review for any company before, good or bad, but the person I spoke to clearly had no idea what he was doing and I would have thought w/ all the trouble I had with this order that they may have given me better assistance in expediting the order.  As much as I like the selection of items on Amazon, I will never use them again, there are other companies like Overstock,com, that have much better, knowledgeable Customer Service Representatives willing to work with you to solve your issues.
title: “Customer Service”

content: bought several items from them, I wanted to change the delivery address BEFORE it was delivered, from San Marcos TX to Austin TX. They had me on the phone 1:30 minutes talking to some oriental girl with a very strong accent, just to tell me at the end it could NOT be done!!!!!
title: “so so service”

content: This Review isn't so much about product as it is security. The other day I get a warning txt from my bank for suspicious activity on my credit card. I only have used this card 3 times as it's my Christmas time credit card. I look into my things and low and behold the only place I've  used it was Best Buy and Amazon. Best buy was to put a return credit bk to it . I look and see I used Amazon well long story short they purchased things from 6 different sellers and had shipped to another state. The biggest one was 2 prime Accts 100 bucks a piece. This makes the 3rd time for myself both my parents had it happen as well. Before everyone says get better anti virus I do I.T and networking. Amazon is so. Big that there security implements don't suit there size so to everyone out there watch your statements and document all transactions as to the seller, product and price. Hope everyone has a Great Day thanks.
title: “To many hacked Accts”

content: China the ," Land of no Returns" counterfeits and toxic products. No returns because it is either fake, cheap,or laden with toxic material. Amazon sucks now! Buyers beware!
title: “Made in China”

content: I took out a free 30-day trial of Amazon Prime and ordered some goods for next day delivery. Nothing arrived and after 5 days Amazon admitted that they had "lost" them. After my having to chase Amazon up three times the goods were then resent and finally arrived after 1 week in total.
title: “Amazon Prime is rubbish”

content: i bought memory off amazon 4 sticks the sender sent me 4 stick seperatly and charged me 4 quid for each stick? amazon said it had nothing to do with them, ive never bought anything since allthough i was a good customer,
title: “daylight robbery”

content: Since Amazon went to outside contractors Amazon cannot and will not honor the delivery day they specified. I waited 2 days at the house to make sure no one took the packages off my front porch. When Amazon was using USPS, FedEx or UPS the shipments were always on time. Now that they use their own couriers, nothing gets here on time. I canceled the orders and rescinded my Prime membership and will be going back to Ebay.
title: “Delivery service is terrible”

content: I use to go to Amazon for everything. I would save a ton. If I made a mistake they would help me and refund me promptly. Recently I have had some troubles with them. Refunds never refunded and items sent damaged to the point I was cut open not knowing the bottom of an electronic was cracked which led me to the hospital today due to an awful infection I got from the unit. Amazon wouldn't replace the item even though it was covered in my blood and returning it would expose others to blood borne pathogens. I discarded the dangerous contaminated unit and Amazon refused to help me remotely. They offered me $5 gift card for my troubles and I never got that even. So sad I loved Amazon
title: “Totally lost faith in my favorite site”

content: I am NOT a fan of Amazon, but it was not always this way. In spite of the shipping costs; which add anywhere from 50% to 150% of the cost of the item being ordered to the final cost of that order. No, that I was able to overlook. My problem with Amazon is actually with their third-party sellers. Amazon is not doing its due diligence in determining whether these are reputable sellers worthy of having access to Amazon's advertising and customers. My kindle is full of books bought with free books given me by Amazon due to countless gaffs by; "Yep, you guessed it"; third party sellers. Unfortunately most of the items I require are not offered by Amazon, and therefore NOT stocked in their warehouses. I have been sent items that I did not order instead of what I did order, I have NOT received anything at all, I have been informed the day before the item was supposed to be delivered, that it would not be coming at all. My laundry list of reasons why I am BOYCOTTING AMAZON. But none of them are actually Amazon's fault. Well, not directly their fault. But their negligence in rectifying this state of affairs, has created or allowed this deplorable inconsistency in service to exist. That being said; if Amazon were to take my countless suggestions about eliminating Third-party sellers, or were they to find a way to find some way to ensure me that I would receive what I ordered, when I ordered it, or if they could guarantee a significantly earlier email telling me the item cannot be delivered.  If they didn't rip me off for a large portion of my shipping costs when those items are not delivered then I would go back to them in a second.
title: “Do NOT Trust Amazon”

content:
I ordered a Duvet through Amazon on the 18 of Nov. I still do not have it and its 11th of Dec 2017. 

They have lost it once and told me 3 different delivery times and it never arrived cancelled the order telling me to re-order and then give me another delivery date date which proved to be incorrect.

Im still waiting for it. 

They have offered me £10 compensation, but this does not compensate for the £120 spent on another Duvet from a local shop as we have got so fed up with waiting. I suspect it might arrive when the weather warms up a bit.
title: “Rubbish and cold”

content: I have been dealing with this incompetence for nearly a week.  On Monday December 4, i ordered shoes that were to be delivered December 6.  They were.  However, instead of a size 9, you sent a 14. I immediately called and told them i needed these shoes ASAP.  I was told in order to do so, they would credit my Amazon account the amount and would reorder.  This was supposed to be credited within 1-2 hours.  Nope.  So i called again and spoke to someone else who magically was able to immediately credit my account.  So i immediately ordered the shoes and called back like i was told to do. I was then told the shoes would be overnighted on December 6 and i would receive them on December 7.  I was even given a tracking number.  Turns out she lied and gave me tracking number for the shoes i already had.  She also said i would get a $20 credit on my account. Great.  So Thursday morning i again called and was told no they werent shipped but they would be overnighted Thursday.  And guaranteed to arrive by Friday at 8pm.  Still no shoes.  Disappointed daughter.  And still no help from Amazon. Excuse after excuse.  Im actually a Prime member, so Im apparently paying to be screwed over. So angry.  Ive never seen this much incompetence from one company.  Filed a complaint with BBB.
title: “Horrible customer service”

content:
The day after Thanksgiving, I needed some vitamins and body lotion and it seemed like Amazon had the best prices and I got free shipping because my order was over a certain amount.  So I put everything in my basket and confirmed that the prices were right and that I had free shipping, but then I decided to look at one more store, keeping everything in my basket at Amazon.  Within about 15-20 minutes when I went back to my basket on Amazon, they had changed things.  My shipping was no longer free and the body lotion I ordered went up $1.00 - in my basket, they said there had been a price change in the body lotion.  I couldn't believe it and I couldn't afford it so I emptied my basket and checked RiteAid's site and ordered from them.  

I got everything at RiteAid on sale for 30% off and then I got an extra bottle of vitamin C for 50% off because I had ordered another bottle and I got free shipping because I had ordered a certain amount.  

I have ordered from Amazon before and I have never had a problem but after this, I probably will not be ordering from them again.
title: “They get zero stars but I had to make a selection so  they got one”

content: I listed, sold and shipped speakers with Amazon 4 weeks ago. I have yet to be paid. I called and after struggling to understand the Indian rep, they acknowledged they owed me but could not explain why I hadn't been paid.  After a few ore calls I was told to stop calling and file my concerns via email. After several emails I was told my account is under review, then at the two week mark, I was asked to stop emailing them and that they would get to me within 45 days. They stole my speakers and they are acting like pimps now. WOW
title: “Don Not Sell with Amazon: Learn to speak Indian”

content: The latest report by an undercover agent in the press goes to show how diabolical the treatment of Amazon packing and dispatch staff in the UK is.  Absolutely disgraceful - I will never use Amazon again.
title: “Treatment of staff”

content: Nothing but problems, orders very late in arriving or sent to the wrong cities repeatedly. Every week on the telephone with a foreigner at Amazon who, for the most part, was incapable of being understood. You do have a right to ask for an American rep, after a 10 min. wait, I was connected to the same foreign rep, avoid this place! Also expensive.
title: “Not ready for $99 Prime Time”

content: Been with amazon for over 10 years and have been a prime member since it was offered. They recently lost all my faith and therefore my business. I have had to contact amazon about incorrect and delayed shipments this year more than all the years I have been a member and three times just this week. They don't care not one bit and just throw refunds at you. It used to be it would go back to your card but now they are just giving you store credit so even if you do get your money back you can't use it anywhere but at amazon and on top of that it only applies to items sold by amazon exclusively... so is it really a "refund" ? As amazon gets bigger it will only suffer the same problems that got me shopping on there in the first place and for me I started shopping on amazon because I was tired of poor customer service and inflexible store policies. (ie. Walmart, Target, etc.) I bet they won't even see this post or care but they just lost a customer who used to buy thousands of dollars of goods a year exclusively with amazon and would rather stand in line at Walmart then deal with their lies. Ultimately calling and chatting and tracking packages all day takes up more time than standing in line.
title: “Amazon: Promises the world... delivers pebbles”

content: I am a prime member and love the 2 day shipping. I have never had a problem returning anything. I find everything on their site.
title: “You can find anything on Amazon”

content: My account was hacked and the bottom-feeder used my gift card to purchase something. I called Amazon customer service (loose term) and sorta-spoke to a rep - sorta because her accent was so thick it was very hard to understand her especially when she talked over me. I explained the situation several times and after being on hold for 15 minutes while she researched she said she'd call back. That took an hour+ and she called and said she'd felid the situation over to an account manager who'd contact me in 24-48 hours. later that day I got an email saying my password was disabled and when I logged in again I had to change it and re-add all of my shipping addresses. So today I tried to log in, but when I did the Forget-Password screen, entering my email address, I got an error - no such email address. had the same one for 13 years and have been on Amazon about the same time and bought HUNDREDS of items. So I decided to torture myself and called customer service and got another accented rep. I explained the situation multiple times, and spelled my email address multiple times and she said she'd turn it over to an account rep and I'd hear back from them in 24-28 hours. GOOD GOD! Am I dirt? Unimportant? They don't want my business? Can they not FIX THIS NOW????? Some idiot disabled not only my password but my email ID and I'm paying for their inefficiency in stress and grief.
title: “They "Fixed" My Hacked Aco$#*! by DELETING it!!”

content:
I ordered a new phone from Amazon.com. Before purchasing this phone, I specifically made sure that I was purchasing it from Amazon LLC not one of its vendors who sells things on its website. Even though Amazons price was more expensive then its 3rd party vendors. I was ok paying the xtra. I was not comfortable buying an expensive phone from a 3rd party vendor on Amazon due to warranty issues and not knowing where these vendors are getting their merchandise.

I received the phone. I was shocked to find that it was not a new phone but it was already used. It came just thrown in a box. It wasnt even factory sealed. The phone even had a screen protector on it placed by the prior user. The box that it was in was very beat up and had an address label from some 3rd party vendor who had previously shipped it out a month ago. Needless to say, I was very dissapointed. I contacted Amazon's customer service who acted like it was not a big deal. Clearly this happens alot.
However, this was the first time I had personally experienced it. It left a bad taste in my mouth. I already ordered the phone from another Retailer today. They used to be a good company to order from but I am not sure whats happening with them now.
title: “Brought new and Amazon sent me a used product”

content: So I just searched an item on Amazon.ca, and I add it to my cart. The price immediately jumped from $173 to $239 as I checked out. After searching for a phone number, they proceeded to tell me that that they can't price match. My response to them was that "price matching involves 2 stores or websites, it doesnt involve a price discrepency off of your own website". They then asked if they can help me with anything else, and I told them "no, and that is the last time I ever order personally or for my business from Amazon again".
title: “I wish they had 0 stars”

content: I have been loyal customer of amazon for many years. During this black Friday, I ordered few items, however amazon default selected my old address. Unfortunately I missed reviewing it (my mistake), reached out to amazon chat agent. After lengthy discussion (multiple chat agents), amazon was not able to change my shipping address. They provided options like refund, but I needed the product only change I need was change in shipping address. They bounced me between multiple chat agents. Started asking me to contact seller, contact UPS etc. When I contact UPS, due to method amazon is selected, only amazon can change the address and I cannot do it. But Amazon throw up their hands. Ask me re order with higher price. I was perplexed that company like amazon do not have proper process in place to change the shipping while it is in transit. Overall it was very stressful experience, moreover I would probably lose $100+ worth of goods as I have no way of collecting or returning the item.
title: “Unable to change shipping address”

content: I don't know why USPS has picked up the reputation of worst shipper in US. The worst shipper is AMAZON. Unless you pay extra or join their Prime! Do you know it takes them 3 to 4 days to fill and another 3 to 4 days to ship and average order. You do a lot better checking the internet or EBay.
title: “Worst fullfiler ever”

content: Made a purchase, thank God a relatively small one. Purchase amount charged to bank account as it should be. However my available balance was reduced by the same amount again. That is, twice the purchase amount. Found this out when I tried to use debit card at CVS, would not go thru. Contacted bank, they said the authorization had not been deleted when the actual charge went thru. Bank could not remove, said Amazon screwed up and would need to fix it. Amazon customer service could not even understand the problem, let alone fix it. Said the authorization would clear in 8-10 business days. You kidding me! I will not order again from Amazon unless I can tolerate a double hit to my bank for a couple weeks. Unbelieveable!!!
title: “WARNING: Double charged debit card”

content: Amazon puts up "deals of the day" and "lightning deals".  Lightning Deals are limited time and quantity noted. Not so with deals of the day.  Today I saw a Butterball Electric Turkey Fryer, a deal of the day at $87.19.  I placed it in my cart, and went to speak with my partner before confirming the order. Upon return, it was gone - and marked as sold out.  I contacted Amazon customer service, and ended up with an agent ("Riti") who, in rather poor English, instructed me that Amazon deals are only good for as long as Amazon says so, and once it says its over (even a deal of the day with hours to go), it is over, done - my only option being a link to buy it for $50 more.  REALLY?????  I think my option includes shopping elsewhere.  Who the hell do they think they are?  I think I , like many, get lulled by their seeming convenience, but other companies list the same items for pretty much the same prices or sometimes less.  Message to Mr. Bezos:  We have choices.  Oh, and fukc you, you can take your turkey fryer and stick it where the sun don't shine.
title: “Amazon sucks”

content:
Ordered clothing on November 5- never notified order was canceled. Called customer service- they said out of stock- but they were still selling it on Amazon website!!! Rep said it was being sold by another 3rd party seller because "maybe the other company was Chinese" What kind of company is this??? 
A digrace.
title: “Too big to do anything right”

content:
DO NOT EVER TRY TO SELL ON AMAZON! Amazon is a credit card fraud company.

11/10/17

I made what I thought to be an individual free simple account, I added no item and had no activity on it and immediately received a 60£ charge from my credit card, no authorization, no invoice, no explanation. No window in the interface as to why. But to receive the refund, I am being told I need to be "verified" as seller. Who the hell would ever want to sell there after that? Amazon, if you haven't decided I am worthy to be your seller, you cannot charge me in advance either! The experience for a month to get the refund for that and close the account is the most horrific experience with "customer service" in my life! Seller Support is a scam department lying to you about 'escalating the issue" and the Account Specialist calling you back till kingdom come. I was told two times, in writing, the refund was sent back to my bank account and actually waited for it to pay my bills. When you call Amazon Seller Support, everything they say is a deliberate, scamming, Mafia type lie. They are all in India, barely speak English, and all called John and Mary. Every single time, another person with another name answers, has no clue about your case and tells you a different, contradictory story/solution. They keep telling you they 'escalate" the issue to a phantomatic department/account specialist that never answers and you go in a loop forever. Thieves and scammers! DO NOT EVER ADD YOUR CREDIT CARD IN THEIR SYSTEM. You can't even delete it afterwards. The worst Customer Support on the planet, shear incompetence and thievery.

Tip for consumers: DO NOT ADD bank information of any kind on their website!
title: “DO NOT EVER TRY TO SELL ON AMAZON! Amazon is a credit card fraud company”

content: I ordered a motherboard 15 October while it was still in stock. It's 10 November now and it still hasn't shipped. The item was in stock when I ordered it and 3 weeks after I ordered it, but it still wasn't in stock. I was told countless times that my order would ship and get to me within the 30 October time frame. When the delivery date passed, I was still told that it would be expedited to reach to me as soon as possible. When the motherboard finally sold out, I was told that it would be restocked the next business day and that the shipment would be expedited to reach to me quickly. Lie after life, 9 November rolled around and I was given a gift card and told to reorder so my order would ship to me quickly  10 November, I cancelled the order and was told that the shipment would be standard and that it could not be change. Well played Amazon, nice scam you've got going on. Well played, I will never use amazon again. Thanks for the great customer support. I hope you treat all your customers like this
title: “Amazon is a scam”

content: Have been a customer for many years and always got what I ordered, on time, and as described. Recently, I decided to write reviews. They were all good, until I wrote this for an order of Dove's Powder roll deodorant: "My favorite deodorant. Hard to find in stores. Pricier at Amazon but always in stock". And then I gave it 5 stars. And then some pencil head at Amazon, said they couldn't publish it because it violated their rules - of course their problem is that I said the product was "pricier". So, no more reviews.
title: “Don't do peoduct reviews”

content:
Both Customer Support & Seller are pathetic. Before making an order, I asked them if the item will be deliverable, to India(International delivery, USA to India), both customer support and seller said item will be delivered to India. But even then, before making an order, I tried to ask the same question from several customer support and they all said deliverable to India. Finally, I bought $2000 amazon gift card from third party. I made an order of laptop Dell Alienware 17 R4, I used gift card, and paid rest of the amount from my debit card. 

Following are the details.

===================================================
ORDER # 113-2215371-0609818

ORDER PLACED October 7, 2017
Alienware AW17R4-7006SLV-PUS 17" Gaming Laptop (7th Generation Intel Core i7, 16GB RAM, 256GB SSD + 1TB HDD, Silver) with NVIDIA GTX 1070

Seller ==> Beach Camera Same Day Shipping 

===================================================

They cancelled my order, and when I asked customer support they asked me to make order again, as there must be some mistake. So I made the order again on 10th October. Following are the details.
===============================================
ORDER # 113-7252378-8515458
ORDER PLACED October 10, 2017

Alienware AW17R4-7006SLV-PUS 17" Gaming Laptop (7th Generation Intel Core i7, 16GB RAM, 256GB SSD + 1TB HDD, Silver) with NVIDIA GTX 1070

Seller ==> Beach Camera Same Day Shipping 

===============================================

They cancelled my order again. I again talked to customer support and seller both and really this made me crazy. They were giving wrong information, offering me $5-$20 for all of this trouble. Amazon Customer Support do not value their customer's time. 

Finally, I need to write mail to Jeff Bezos CEO of Amazon and then I came to know, this item could not be delivered to India. and neither they can refund my Amazon gift card as it was bought by 3rd party, and neither 3rd party allows any refund. So my $2000 became waste now. I just sent my $2000 gift card code, to Jeff Bezos, as a contribution to improve the Amazon Pathetic Customer Support.

content:
I purchased a 65 inch SUHD TV through Amazon.com.  I purchased within their marketplace sector of their website.  The TV was delivered damaged.  Amazon has refused to help.

Here is the main problem.

Amazon marketplace is a wild west of vendors that apparently have no vetting process and some are not even companies.  This was my experience.  I purchased the TV from a vendor called Infinity Loop.  Infinity loop initially talked to me and gave me a phone number when i reported the damaged TV.  I called and the warehouse didn't even know who Infinity Loop was.  I had to explain my purchase from Amazon and the operator directed me to a rep.  That rep said they would have get the owner to call back.  Well that never happened.  They stopped communicating all together.  I had to use Amazon messaging (dozens of attempts to get them to respond).  I eventually contacted Amazon who gave me a warm and fuzzy about helping me.  Well after . several supervisors and several warm and fuzzies they eventually said they couldn't help and wouldn't continue to respond.  

Here is the problem.  I received the TV damaged.  It's obvious by the pictures it's a forklift punch through the box and into the screen.  I asked the driver about the hole in the box and he told me it happens all the time and put my hand through it and check.   He assured me the TV's are always fine.  I checked and only felt that soft velvety cover they put over the screens.  Nothing at all made me think that the screen actually was touched.  I was in the process of moving and didn't unpack the well packed TV just to repack it for my move.  My mistake.  I should have unpacked and checked it.  HOWEVER it doesn't change the fact it was delivered DAMAGED.  When i unpacked it i saw a small tear (about the size of a dime) in the outer cover.  I took the cover off and found the deep gouge in the screen but no cracking or any other visible damage.  I plugged it in and the screen was totally unusable.  Since then it's been a very disappointing experience with Amazon.  No matter what evidence I've sent in regarding the size/shape of the hole fitting a warehouse forklift fork....the link between Mizari and Infinity Loop....the shipping company acknowledging the damage likely happened while in their control (only Mizari can file a claim as the account holder).....my horrible experience trying to work with Amazon customer service......they disappeared and forced me to seek legal advice.

I've had to file a small claims case against Amazon to try to get my money back.  

Infinity Loop doesn't exist.  There is no business license for them anywhere.  I did research the warehouse and phone number and found out they are actually called MIZARI Enterprises.  Mizari denies any knowledge of Infinity Loop.  Mizari and Infinity loop have the same address in Commerce CIty, CA and have the same phone number.  The shipping receipt has Mizari's address on Wilshire Blvd in Los Angeles.  Mizari shipped the TV.  The shipping company confirmed this.  It's amazing to me that AMAZON is defending MIZARI and their fraudulent marketplace vendor INIFINITY LOOP and not their customer. 

Amazon marketplace is a huge gamble and risk should anything go wrong
title: “Amazon marketplace has fraudulent companies selling through their website”

Now I am left with no laptop and out of pocket by £2300 pounds and bitter a dispute. Feel like an Idiot!

Anand.
title: “Rubbish and Appalling.”

content:
Being a seller in Amazon's marketplace is now a bit of a joke. Like eBay, it's been one round of 'compliance' after another, sometimes due to EU rules treating everyone as potential money-laundering terrorists.

As a seller, I was working for peanuts, as the competition is so great and the 15% commission excessive. 

With increasing use of Amazon's FBA (fulfilled by Amazon), I was increasingly failing to win the 'Buy Box' and so losing out on orders, as many people don't bother to compare prices and sellers. Even when I was cheapest and with 100% feedback, Amazon and FBA sellers were just about always, if not always, rewarded with the Buy Box.

From now on, I am going to try to grow my brand without Amazon. For one thing, customer loyalty is almost zero with Amazon marketplace.

The danger for consumers is that, because Amazon has been happy to work for next to no profit for years, they are able to undercut almost everyone. And because of Amazon's vast reach, many businesses feel that they have to sell there, often selling at lower prices than on their own website, despite Amazon's charges.

The consequence could be that in another decade or two, nearly all internet sales are handled through third party sites like eBay and Amazon. Businesses will basically no longer be independent, increasing merchandise will be banned as they are deemed politically incorrect (such as all Confederate flag items, as just one example).

They will be able to set prices by setting their fees and we will only have easy access to the books they think we ought to read and the music and films we should own and the food we should eat.

Join me in boycotting Amazon, as a seller and as a buyer, otherwise we will be at the mercy of these kind of companies and in my experience, they don't do much in the way of mercy.
title: “Amazon: a danger in waiting?”

content:

3) I was told that the only way to address the issue was to be refunded for the missing item and re-order the missing item.  
4) Why is the customer required to take these actions when it is clearly the fault of Amazon and the inadequacy of their product supply process.  Your Customer Service did not provide any applicable service, since they do not have the ability to process an order over the phone, only view the order and offer upgraded shipping options, which in fact did not improve the arrival date.
5) How does a company this size not have a mechanism do deal with order shortages.
title: “Multi-billion dollar company has customer deal with missing item”

content:
Below is a review I wrote for a product I bought from Amazon. It explains my issue. I was correct, they refused to post it. I included pictures with the review as proof. The product is called Razor Cuts by Hotstuff. Suddenly it's "Currently unavailable. We don't know when or if this item will be back in stock". Here's the review:
BEWARE OF BUYING THIS PRODUCT FULFILLED BY AMAZON!!!
BEWARE OF BUYING THIS PRODUCT FULFILLED BY AMAZON FOR THE $12.95 PRICE.
RECEIVED BOTTLE AND LOOKED FOR EXPIRE DATE, IT WAS ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOTTLE PRINTED ON A STICKER THAT WAS SLITED INTO 4 SECTIONS. I AM FAMILIAR WITH THIS PRODUCT, I HAVE PURCHASED IT IN THE PAST SO I KNOW WHERE THE EXPIRE DATE SHOULD BE. WHERE IT SHOULD BE WAS ON THE EDGE OF THE BOTTLE'S LABEL, BUT COVERING THE EDGE OF THE LABEL THERE WAS A LONG AMAZON LABEL WITH THE NAME OF THE PRODUCT AND AMAZON'S BAR CODE. I PEELED OFF AMAZON'S LABEL TO FIND THE EDGE OF THE BOTTLE'S LABEL HAD BEEN CUT OFF, I COULD SEE THE RAZOR BLADE MARK LEFT ON THE BOTTLE. I PEELED OFF THE STICKER ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOTTLE TO SEE IF THERE WAS ANYTHING UNDER IT, THERE WAS NOTHING. THIS STICKER LABEL SAID EXPIRE DATE 7/18. I CALLED HOTSTUFF AND TALKED TO PAUL, HE VERIFIED WERE THE EXPIRE DATE SHOULD BE...ON THE EDGE OF THE LABEL. SENT IT BACK. I'LL BE SURPRISED IF AMAZON POSTS THIS REVIEW.

Paul from Hotstuff ran the lot # on the bottle's label and it's actual expire date is 8/2017....Go figure!

UPDATE 7/18/17.....As of today I am no longer allowed to leave reviews for products I've purchased on Amazon. When I try a window appears saying:.... "Sorry, we are unable to accept your review of this product for either one or both of the following reasons: Your previous review of this product did not comply with our customer service guidelines. Amazon does not permit reviews from customers whose relationship to the product or seller may be perceived as biased".

There are dozens of purchases I have yet to review, none of which I have a relationship with the seller or product.
This is revenge for leaving this review on this site.....Hey Amazon, I DON"T CARE! 

UPDATE 8/9/17......Today I received an email that states:
Hello John,
This is Davin from the Communities team at Amazon.
We have determined that you have violated our Community Guidelines. As a result, we have suppressed all of your reviews, and you will no longer be able to post Amazon Community content.
We made this decision after carefully considering your reviewing account. This decision is final.
Best regards,
Davin S.
Amazon.com
title: “Label tampering....really? (Read updates 7/18/17 & 8/9/17)”

content:
Gone are the days when amazon.com valued its buyers! HA! Your purchase will be held hostage until you PAY UP for shipping- where the *real* (free) money is! I wish I could share my screenshots of their supposed tracking information- USPS states "September 7, 2017, 9:13 am	Picked Up by Shipping Partner, USPS Awaiting Item, ETNA, OH 43018/ September 7, 2017, 5:14 pm Departed Shipping Partner Facility, USPS Awaiting Item ETNA, OH 43018/ Your item departed a shipping partner facility at 5:14 pm on September 7, 2017 in ETNA, OH 43018. This does not indicate receipt by the USPS or the actual mailing date." 

On Amazon.com it shows, "Latest update: Friday, Sep 8 6:49 AM, Shipment arrived at Amazon facility Kenosha, WISCONSIN, US"

The order was PLACED SEPT 3! Since yesterday afternoon (Sept 7) the "tracking" has displayed "Arriving tomorrow by 8 PM"; today is the 8th- STILL says "tomorrow". 

So what, they're right next door to your place; you asked for free shipping, you're getting punished and WILL wait. amazon.com is reflecting sketchy drop-shipping behaviors- sellers can post what ever they want and charge what ever they want[ $40. for shipping an eyeliner? SURE! If buyers are willing to pay it, and you pay for that  posting. So WHAT if it was floating around in sewage?! amazon.com doesn't monitor nor regulate the safety of ANY item unless it is being stored at their physical location- and even *then*, who knows?? amazon.com is BLOWING YOU OFF! As of the date of this posting, you will be able to find amazon.com offerings locally in most metropolitan areas for LESS than on their website. Embrace Walmart. The time wasted awaiting that item for $2. less online would be replaced with the satisfaction that you get to PERSONALLY inspect your item(s) before purchase, and time IS money. amazon.com- go ship to Nigeria!
title: “amazon.com STINKS- ConsumerAffairs.com agrees”

content:
I used to shop on Amazon a lot. The products I received were hit or miss and so were their prices. Often times when I compared pricing - eBay, Etsy, Wal-Mart, Target, and Kohls would have the same or very similar items at lower prices, even if you're paying for a Prime account w/"free" (paid for) shipping.  

But why did I really stop shopping at Amazon? Because Amazon is the reason why over a million workers (between their business and USPS who delivers for them) do not get to enjoy major holidays like  Easter, Memorial Day, Independence  Day, Labor Day,Thanksgiving, and Christmas with their families - because now they're forced to have to be out delivering for Amazon, which could and should allow ALL deliveries to stop for all major holidays. People survived for hundreds of years not getting mail on major holidays or Sundays. Now USPS workers do not get that one (saving grace) day a week to rest their bodies (Sundays), especially between November and February when they need it the most. Amazon is DIRECTLY responsible for lowering the quality of life and family time and rest time for over a million American workers. And because odd that, I had to quit the USPS and have been unemployed and struggling to find work ever since.  I could not physically work 7-day work weeks and miss holidays with my family - and Amazon caused that.  I will never shop from them again and I tell all my fault and friends to do likewise. A few have stopped shopping from them for the same reasons.
title: “Fast shipping equals employees without days off. Products hit or miss.”

Too much trouble and I lost all respect for Amazon.  Do not buy any ANCHEER products.  Do not trust the Amazon reviews either...

content:
Bought an electronic item from Amazon and returned it. Have now dealt with Amazon chat twice about refund and found it excruciating.  First time, I told them vendor had received item back but no refund after seven days.  Was told I would have to wait 60 days before they would review! Second time, today, Aug. 4th, was told they had done refund 7 days before (I had received email confirmation of that fact), but refund wasn't there.  I had used my Amazon credit card. Asked for four digits of account they refunded to and was told they couldn't give it to me for security reasons. They told me to take it up with issuing bank; and, as I told them I didn't know which bank that was since I didn't get that information!

Will NEVER buy electronics through Amazon again (which tend to be returned more, at least by me) and would be hesitant on ANY large dollar purchase to avoid the hellish treatment on refunds.

EBay and PayPal are MUCH easier to deal with on refunds, even AliExpress is easier to deal with.

Amazon has lost a lot of their cache with me (and I still don't know where to look for my money.
title: “Tough to Get Amazon Refund”

content: PLACED 42 VORDERS IN 30 DAYS, SAW IST WEEK I WASN'T GOING TO PAY TO SHOP THERE, ENDED UP RETURNING HALF. SO MUCH MISSING OR INCORRECT INFO IN PRODUCT DETAILS, AND SITE VERY HARD TO NAVIGATE, MOST SEARCH ENGINES REQUIRE AT LEAST A TWO WORD HIT TO SHOW AN ITEM WHEN SEARCHING, AMAZON'S SITE USES A ONE WORD HIT. SEARCHED FOR FOLDABLE PLASTIC WORK HORSES, GOT 2,208 HITS, 6 WERE WORK HORSES, 2 WERE PLASTIC. TAKES HOURS TO FIND WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR AND THEN THEY HAVE SO MANY RESTRICTIONS ON SHIPPING, PROMO'S, ECT. IT JUST ISN'T FEASIBLE TO USE THEM. AND WHAT OTHER SITE THAT SELLS AT RETAIL OR ABOVE CHARGES TO USE IT? NONE. ONLY REASON I TRIED WAS THE LARGEST AND OLDEST ONLINE SHOPPING SITE HAS BEGUN TO ALLOW 3RD PARTY SELLERS. THE LAST 5 ITEMS I ORDERED THERE CAME FROM AMAZOM, I FIGURED I'D CUT OUT THE MIDDLE MAN, BUT IT'S SIMPLY IMPOSSIBLE. I HAVE 73 EMAILS FROM THAT 30 DAY PERIOD FROM CUSTOMER SERVICE, WHERE I HAD TO CALL IN ABOUT PROBLEMS WITH ORDSERS, BEING CHARGED TWICE FOR SAME ORDER, ONCE WHEN PLACED, THENAGAIN WHEN SHIPPED, AND I'M NOT TALKING ABOUT PENDING CHARGES, BUT CHARGES THAT WERE PROCESSED. NEEDLASS TO SAY, I MADE SURE I GOT ALL ITEMS REURNED BEFORE THE 30 DAYS WERE UP. ANYONE CAN SHOP THERE, BUT YOU DON'T GET THAT 2 DAY FREE SHIPPING. AND NOW THAT THEY CHARGE TAX ON EVERY ORDER, WHICH ID AGAINST THE LAW IN MY STATE, SINCE THEY DON'T HAVE A DISTRIBUTION CENTER WITHIN THE STATE, YOU MIGHT AS WELL BUY LOCALLY. WHEN I ASKED THEY SAID IT WAS FEDERAL LAW. THAT'S A FLAT OUT LIE, SALES TAX LAWS DIFFER FROM STATE TO STATE AS DOES AMOUNT, AND SOME STATES DON'T CHARGE ANY SALES TAX ON EDIBLE GOODS, YET AMAZON COLLECTS ON ALL. BUT THEY CAN'T BE TRUNING IT IN TO THE STATES, JUST ANOTHER WAY TO INCREASE PROFITS. ONE ITEM I ORDERED FROM PRIME, CAME FROM A 3 RD PARTY VENDOR, HE LEFT THE INVOICE IN THE BOX, THE MARK UP WAS 100%, I PAID 48.05, AMAZON PAID 24.67. THEY HAVE NO OVERHEAD BUT THE COST OF THE WEBSITE AND THE CUSTOMER SERVICE REOS OVER THE PHONE, WHICH IS 70% OUTSOURCED TO MANILLA AND INDIA, ONE AMAZON REP,USA BASED, ADMITTED HE DIDN'T KNOW WHERE MANILA WAS, OR THAT INDIA WAS A COUNTRY, THOUGHT IT WAS THE NAME OF A CONTINENT. AGAIN POORLY TRAINED, SITE DIFFICULT TO USE, TOO MUCH TIME TO RESOLVE ISSUES, AN AVERAGE OF 3 CALLS AND 2 HOURS ON PHONE EVERYTIME. I WENT BACK TO OTHER SITE, NOW I JUST ASK IF THEY HAVE IT IN STOCK, OR A QUESTION ABOUT THE PRODCUT. IF THEY RESPOND ALL THEY KNOW IS WHAT'S LISTED I DON'T BUY FROM THEM. THERE ARE PLENTY OF SELLERS WHO STOCK THEIR OWN ITEMS AND ARE INTERESTED IN CUSTOMER SERVICE TO HAVE TO PUT UP WITH THIS MESS. AND MESS IT IS, TALKED TO 7 ACCOUNT SUPERVISORS, ALL WERE HELPFUL, AND ALL WERE LOOKING FOR ANOTHER JOB. SAYS SOMETHING WHEN EMPLOYEES AREN'T LOYAL TO THOSE THAT SIGN THEIR CKS.
title: “TRIED 30 DAY FREE TRIAL, WORST 30 DAYS OF MY 62 YEARS”

content:
I had a simple and unpleasant act of theft turn into a unnecessarily frustrating ordeal all thanks to Amazon. They're support us understaffed and under trained and there are no proper protocols, policy or supervision in place to protect consumers.

Long story short, instead of immediately refunding me for a fraudulent charge they FROZE it. Meaning the money was still debited from my bank account even though the item was NEVER shipped out. Amazon failed to take proper notes of my case and gave me the run around. 3 weeks later my bank reversed the charge and said from beginning Amazon should have simply refunded me.

I had to pay to mail the phone back again, go back to AT&T for a new SIM card for the fourth time and decided to just buy a new phone from them. I email asking how long before I get my refund and am told 1 to 5 business days after they receive my package. I track the package and it was received almost a week ago. Its been over a month and I still don't have a working phone from them or a refund. Have a feeling they are trying to jack me around and say they never got it. Once they were ALL finally listed it took a LONG time with their SLOW SLOW population of my goods before they started to sell. NOW I HAVE MONEY IN MY ACCOUNT THEY WON'T PAY ME.  That is because they have no problem at all accepting my MasterCard for payment of ANYTHING they want to sell me but they will not put my profits on the card OR in my bank account.  They way that they want me to open a new bank account and get a VISA to be paid.  It is the MOST ridiculous way to keep my money that I have EVER heard of!!!  Additionally, they sell their used books for so cheap on Amazon that the customers expect new books to sell cheap too.  So, you don't make much money.  I am a published author and have two books on Amazon that are not doing well because they only do well when I offer a FREE promotion.  Amazon does VERY little to help their SELLERS and too much to spoil their buyers.  What they don't understand is that their biggest buyers are their sellers but not for much longer.  People are getting wise to Amazon.

content:
If you had asked me to review Amazon.com 2 years ago, I most likely wouldn't have had a bad thing to say about them. For the past year and a half, it has gone so far down hill.
I would always order from Amazon and use the Super Saver Shipping, and most of the time, I would get my purchases earlier than the expected delivery date.
Once I became an invitee to a Prime membership, I would get my packages in the guaranteed 2 days.
Lately, there have been numerous late packages. I would say 9 out of 10 packages are late. When I see "Guaranteed Delivery" by a certain date, I absolutely count on that. Especially, if it's a gift for someone.
As if late packages weren't bad enough, 8 out of 10 items arrive damaged. It's a shame that the convenience of ordering products from Amazon.com has come with the inconvenience of damaged item returns so frequently.
I had asked a representative about accessing Prime music or video through my account, and was told that as a member, I can access it. When it didn't work, I had to speak to someone in music department and was told that as an invitee to Prime, I am not entitled to the free music downloads with my own account.
Customer service has been terrible in giving wrong information, and promising replacements the next day that don't arrive, then nonchalantly say that it'll be there the day after. This becomes a problem when you're expecting it that day, and sometimes, even wait for it.
2 years ago, Amazon.com would've gotten 5 stars from me. Being a customer for over 10 years have seen how far down hill they have gone. Their customer service used to be tops, and delivery was always on point. 
I hate to say it, but Amazon.com truly earned this 1 star for their lack of customer service and not living up to their guarantees.
title: “What happened to Amazon?”

content: I used Amazon to purchase most of the items needed for my son's wedding. I had no issue with any of the vendors but one. It was for two sets of engraved dog tags by TagZ. Both sets engravings were wrong and had two different dates, neither of which were the actual wedding date. Since they arrived too late to return we had no way of replacing them and they just had to be tossed out. When Amazon sent me the email to review the different products I had purchased they accepted ALL EXCEPT the review for this company stating that they arrived late, vendor did not reply to email sent, and the engraving was wrong on both of them. BEWARE of the reviews on Amazon as they are very selective of which one they will allow to be posted. The only thing in their guidelines that they sent me for why they could have possibly denied my review is that the purchase must be $50 or mores. The irony is most of the other purchase they had me review for the same event were all under $50 but as they were mostly positive it seems that was the criteria used as to which ones they allowed to be posted and which one they denied to post.
title: “Amazon prevents unfavorable reviews from being posted on vendors”

content: Really down on Amazon right now because today, not for the 1st time, I added what I needed to my cart and went to checkout where I was then told I needed $XX.XX more for free shipping. So I spent 15 minutes going through the house looking for essentials to order. Another 15 minutes was spent finding ones I actually could add top my cart because half of them had a prime only button. So now, we're a half hour in on what should be a pretty simple and FAST ordering process. My cart finally shows I qualify for free shipping, so I hit the checkout button... and voila, there's a 14.95 charge for shipping! Well, if I've got to pay for shipping I might as well just order the couple of items I really needed, right? WRONG. Amazon no longer has delete buttons next to each of the items in your shopping cart... not even one to clear the entire list to start over!!! This is what happens when companies get to big -- it's no longer about what they can do for you, it's what you can do for them.
title: “bait and switch check out process”

content:
My customer Amazon account was hacked and I reported it after seeing my email had been changed.  I was assured everything was cool and I would not be charged for any activity.  

A week later I started getting emails saying customers wanted to know why I had sent their purchases to the wrong address,  After that I started getting notices from Amazon, they would be charging my account for the 48+ refunds.  Fortunately, my gut told me to cancel the accounts associated with the account a week earlier and I acted on it.  I once had a seller account in 2007 but stopped using it because the only sales I made were from fraudulent accounts.  I guess the hackers knew how to activate it.

I have called several times and have been assured the account has been sent to their "tech" department.  I have only spoken to 1 person who spoke English as their first language.  Most of the other folks I spoke with were Chinese or Indian and could care less what was going on.  I have tried to explain I have the name of the store name the hackers are using but I am them told they can't add anything to my case once it's been sent to "tech" but "tech" would be getting back to me...it's been 9 days now and I'm pretty sure I won't be hearing from them anytime soon, if at all.

I do have an email that states I do not have a sellers account with Amazon but no other details and it ends with asking me to email them at the enclosed link if I have any questions or concerns.  I clicked on it and it goes to the logon page which of course, I can no longer click on.

I am worried I will be prosecuted for something I have not done.  I am also worried I will be sued for the refund amounts since they are not able to charge any of the accounts I had attached to it.  

My advice, DON'T USE AMAZON.  It's not worth it.  Buy and sell your products elsewhere, you'll be glad you did.
title: “My Amazon Account Was Hacked - What A Nightmare!”

I have done this at least twice and end up buying at Walmart.ca, who are highly reliable with price and delivery.

content:
I was a seller for few months. Not a single complaint from a client etc. Everyone was happy. Then suddenly account gets blocked without explanation. First I thought it's a technical error. 

I called up the customer rep and was told that someone will call be back within 2 days. No one ever called.

I repeated the above about 5 times. No one ever got back to me.

I thought that my account got hacked and sent a letter directly to Amazon UK. Just like with the phone calls, they didn't bother to respond. It became obvious that the company has something to hide.

I have a reason to believe that I was a victim of discrimination and they don't want to admit that so I can't sue them. 

I spoke to a lawyer about the whole thing and I requested copy of my documents via letter. They refused to provide me with information whom should I address in that letter (so called data controller) which is already an offence in the EU. I got it somehow and sent a letter but just like before they ignored it (offence number two: they're legally obliged to respond within 40 days)

I had to use legal letter to get ANY response. Their response was that they wouldn't give me anything until I verify my ID. So I did. Now they request a copy of my lease :D

I believe I'm on something here. A company that doesn't have anything to hide doesn't act like that so I will continue my journey.

Also as a way of saying thank you for their cooperation I will be creating a special website and facebook page which guides people on how to get their information from them step by step, for free.
title: “Discrimination case”

content: Absolutely horrible company with a really shaddy record when it comes to dealing fairly. They claimed they were advertising "natural turquoise" and when you go to their page all it has was Chinese imported junk!!!! Disgusting that they can get away with things like this.
title: “Terrible company”

content:
In addition to part-timers having to work 11 hours on their feet, they must also rush and race because they are being timed as they pick orders. They only receive a 30 minute lunch. By the time one gets to the time clock which is located on the opposite end of the warehouse, and/or utilize the restroom one has 20 minutes left of lunch. Associates are running around having to beat their time instead of focusing on getting the job done in a safe manner. The store only had 2 days without injury which speaks for itself. On my first day, an associate was bleeding from his cheek. Injuries range from knee, arm, head, foot, etc. Working conditions are not what they are suppose to be like for human beings. Vending machines are broken in order to get proper PPE (e.g. gloves, glove liners). I am canceling my Amazon Prime membership and never buying from Amazon again. Working conditions are disgusting. Being fast should not be what is important, SAFETY is what is important. Amazon would not be the world's most "customer-centric company" without its associates. One can't even utilize the restroom unless they are on break or lunch, because it affects their time, and management will take note of it, so additionally employees must also train their bladder. Sad.

To the CEO Mr. Bezos:

Instead of having employees yell "CORNER" and "CROSSING" when moving along the aisles, you would benefit from not timing employees like they are animals fetching, and concentrate on a humane work environment that is safe for all.

Thank you.
title: “Employees are treated inhumanely.”

content: We are a registered company (HDT Europe) with registered products (Herbal D-Tox). We are trying to make our products available for sale in Amazon.co.uk platform since June 2016, with no success. Yes, since June last year! Since then, we are continuously finding obstacles in the form of several documents that are being asked by the Verification Team, over and over again. Every time we submit a perfectly valid document they ask for another one, sometimes they even had that document, but did not considered it at first! Then, they take their time to verify and tell us sometime later than our first document is outdated or has any other "problem". They do not communicate well within their organization because everytime we talk to one of their associates to get help (countless times, by now) they tell us different things. They ask us to submit blank documents! They ask us to send them documents using fax, instead of email! They only verify our documents better when we get really upset and respond harshly to their nonsense email requests! Are we being discriminated here for some reason? Because we know several companies that work with Amazon.co.uk and did not find this endless loop of problems! Why can't we just start selling after all this time?! We are not planning to wait another eight months. Why aren't their associates doing their job correctly?! This is beyond unacceptable, and by our experience we would never recommend Amazon.co.uk as Sellers! Best regards, HDT Europe
title: “Amazon.co.uk - 8 months waiting to sell!”

content:
I madde a purchase from Amazon on 12/14. now i have been purchasing from Amazon for years and never had a problem. I was not aware at the time of the purchase that this item was coming from an individual. My order gets updated on 12/15 with a bogus tracking number and the status has not changed since 12/15. I contact Amazon and all I get is you will have to contact the seller and wait 1-2 weeks for a refund. I have contacted the seller several times and there is no phone number and you can only email them. Amazon still will not take responsibility for scammers on their site. When my account was debited it shows Amazon. But they are saying that they gave the money to the seller and will not refund me because the item has been shipped. Even though they can see that the tracking number is not valid on the USPS site. They have no records of the tracking number. The has been the worst experience ever. And all they keep saying is that we cant refund you and this is the only order that you have placed. I guess because they are under the assumption that I have only placed one order they dont care. We have over 10 accounts with them because everyone in my house has their own account. So with that being said I guess because this account only shows 1 Im not important to them. And yes all of my accounts have prime membership and on top of that its not the free trial. Its a paid subscription. They have people who get on the phones and claim to be managers of the company and when you call back for them no one knows who they are. I also think that thats unfair to lie to your customers to get them off the phone. I have given them nothing but good reviews in the past but after this I will never think to use them again. Everyone be very careful of what you purchase on this site. Because its not up to Amazon to give you a refund its up to the seller. So if your item ships and you never get it you will wait forever for a refund and to think this was a Christmas Gift. And yes my money is very precious to me when I work for it everyday.

ORDER # 109-4854477-2456263
1:57 AM	Package has left seller facility and is in transit to carrier
Carrier: USPS, Tracking #: EV778522419CN

This is all thats available with the tracking number and this is on amazon site.
title: “Will not take responsibility for scammers on their site.”

there where no answer. then after 2 weeks I received letter that amazon decide to close my seller account. Ok. But I ask them to withdraw my balance to my bank account. content: Has anyone tried to self publish an e-book with Amazon Kindle. If you have then you will likely agree with me. Writing any kind of book takes 100's of hours. Then there's your cover and so on. I found this company to be an absolute nightmare every time I published a book. Your formatting will always be wrong and your book will look terrible even if you use their own software. They will accuse you of copyright infringement and reject your book over and over. Sure I sold a few books, but I don't think it was worth the aggravation. I would advise you to look elsewhere. The last straw for me came when they started rejecting images. Not content but images from an online source that offers freely available content. And by the way, their mobi file format is ancient history.
title: “Amazon Kindle Publishing”

content:
I bought a Grundig Satellit 750 Radio from Amazon, when it arrived in Bago City Philippines the shorwave did not work.   I had been warned that Amazon will often ship defective items to people who will have difficulties returning these!   I could not afford the $100 out of pocket after spending so much for this radio (plus customs and shipping) $558.59.  Amazon did not offer to reimburse me for the total costs to ship the item back to them DESPITE THE FACT THAT THE ITEM WAS DEFECTIVE  (offering only up to $20.00 of it).  So since the AM/FM works I decided to keep this DEFECTIVE RADIO!  Well due to the fact that our voltage is 220V here, I ordered a power cord for this radio from Super Power Supply and according to Amazon it was shipped via DHL but when I contacted DHL they said it was shipped via Global Mail ( REGULAR MAIL) but I paid $18.00 for this item to be shipped here via DHL EXPRESS!  I then went online to write a scathing review of this product and received this"Your review could not be posted."  According to Amazon's TOS... This is the copy of that review.

"Buyer Beware SCAM ALERT!

I live in the Philippines and paid Amazon to ship this to my home address. According to Amazon it was shipped by DHL. According to DHL this item went Global Mail! I have not received the package. I can not ask for a refund due to the fact that I can't send back a package that I have not received! I have asked them to send another one but I doubt that this company will. I paid $18.00 with shipping and customs! This was not CHEAP SHIPPING! Yet this company decided to ship it via regular Philippines Post and lie and say that DHL shipped it! Do not trust this company! I have not received the item. I have waited a very long time to write this. I wrote a review earlier (thinking it was with DHL due to Amazon but this review is about the fact that it WAS NOT SENT VIA DHL) I guess we can't trust AMAZON either! Since their site says it was shipped via DHL! 

We encourage you to revise your review and submit it again. A few common issues to keep in mind: 

Your review should focus on specific features of the product and your experience with it. Feedback on the seller or your shipment experience should be provided at www.amazon.com/feedback.
We do not allow profane or obscene content. This applies to adult products too.
Advertisements, promotional material or repeated posts that make the same point excessively are considered spam.
Please do not include URLs external to Amazon or personally identifiable content in your review."
This review you will notice does not have any foul language in it, other than mentioning Amazon several times and my expectation that when they say they shipped something via DHL that it actually is shipped via DHL and not REGULAR MAIL!.  You can not trust Amazon.  They will send you broken items that cost you hundreds of dollars due to the fact that you would not wish to trust them, or pay the very high return shipping costs!  But also they say that they ship a item via a carrier and it turns out to be a LIE!  Do not trust these two companies!
     There are very few companies that allow one the selection Amazon does and for me and others who are living in a foreign country (I'm from the USA) a company like this is very useful.  But when they send a radio as they did me, that is DEFECTIVE and which I paid such a large sum for, and then only offer $20 to return it...well enough said(?)  Do not trust Amazon with expensive purchases.  Do not trust the company I bought the cord from, as it was not the correct cord and was not shipped by DHL but by regular mails which has a history of theft here!  Ok?  So that is all I have to say about this.
title: “Defective items and shipping...”

title: “terrible customer service”

content:
So, my Kindle Voyager died that I purchased in Feb. 2015.  I jump on chat, they take me through the paces, and decide it can't be fixed.  What do you mean it can't be fixed?  It's just a dead battery.  Oh, we can't fix hardware problems.  Okay, well, I'm not paying $199 retail for a brand new one, so, what can you do?  Answer: $20 off a new one.  NOPE!  I call, speak with a guy named Arthur.  I explain everything, and he says not to worry; which immediately made me suspicious.  I tell him I need to purchase it on a payment plan after he tells me he's selling me the new device for $100.  He says he'll give me $40 credit to be used as the first payment, and put $59.99 in my account to be used to make subsequent payments.  I made him explain this 3 times.  He kept saying not to worry, and he'd send me an email with all the details and his name ... just purchase the device, and he'll do all these things on his end.  So, I do it and wait for the email.  I get the email, and it says $159.99 for the device with payments to begin the first month and his name is missing.  Now, all the messed up crap begins.  I decide they lie over the phone, so I start a chat.  The woman is a moron and can't understand what I said happened during the transaction on the previous day.  We go around and around, and then she then says she found $59.99 sitting in promotional credits and can't be applied to payments.  WHAT?  What does that mean?  It means the $59.99 can only be used for future purchases.  I tell her that's not right, and someone needs to fix this.  She passes me onto someone else who says he will refund $59.99 to my card.  Hours have past, and it's like 1am.  I'm so tired at this point, I'm almost falling asleep.  I tell him to do so, and I'll check back the next day.  I check my account & emails the next day, and nothing happened.  I'm saving some of these chats since amazon.com conveniently doesn't allow you to save them.  I call to speak with a supervisor, and I'm already tired and frustrated.  I get passed around, put on hold for 45 minutes, and hang up.  I call back and get hung up on at least 5 times.  Now, I'm steaming mad.  I'm back to chats since people are jerking me around over the phone.  I tell them someone needs to fix this, redo the payment schedule so that the device is $100 like Arthur promised me it would be.  I get passed around some more.

I ask to speak with a supervisor, and I'm absolutely sure I wasn't speaking with a supervisor who blew me off.  Every month, I'm chatting with people, pasting previous chats in the window from Word documents, and asking them what they plan to do.  I get the device, and one of them tells me to send it back and they'll redo everything for $100.  I ask him if he thinks I'm stupid, because everybody is saying something different and now I don't trust any of them.  Send me an email saying this is what would happen if I send it back.  He says no, which makes me know he's lying too.  In September, I file a BBB complaint.  Whoever answered refunds $41 because they took so long, I bought some mp3's which reduced the credit, and before I could ask about redoing the payment schedule, the BBB closes the case.  So, I enter another BBB complaint about that.  Nothing happens.  I get into another chat whereby that rep says he will have someone from the BBB division of Amazon.com address the complaint.  Nothing happens again after a couple of weeks.  So, then I enter in a complaint with the Attorney General of the State of Washington ... Seattle.  Someone at Amazon.com sends back a double-talking response without addressing the payment plan ... again.  The Attorney General's office says there's nothing they can do and to go to small claims court for resolution.  I send back an email with ALL the chats attached and tell them I've been deceived, and small claims court where?  Washington?  I don't think so!  These people act like this isn't an online company and the laws of one State can govern the laws of another.

So, now Amazon.com decides to deactivate my device on 10/7/16 so it can't get any books online.  Fine with me!  It's their money they're losing out on, not mine.  And for what?  Just so they can do and say whatever they want to and not do right by me?  I'm in dire straights, and they keep sending emails saying they want to take $80 from my card, instead of $40 twice and one payment of $20.  I've spent thousands of dollars with Amazon.com on various products over at least 10 years, and they dare treat people like this and make me out to be a liar about the whole thing?  I tell them if they were paying me by the hour, with all the hours, days, months I've spent trying to get them to do the right thing, the device would be paid for by now.  My time is money too!

Nobody is a consumer advocate for online businesses, and a company as large as Amazon.com thinks it can do whatever they want.  I think I've also written the FTC ... not sure ... but, they're another useless organization who does nothing about anything.  Companies are running rip-shod over consumers, and are being held accountable for NOTHING!  They're a monopoly, and there's almost no way around purchasing things online without going through Amazon.com.  I'm disgusted and definitely looking for other options to help with this.  Any ideas, folks?
title: “Kindle Voyager Nonsense!!!”

content:
I am an indie author. I have dealt with Amazon for over a year and half. Mostly a good experience. But I am frustrated by the lack of professionalism and double standards Amazon has when reviewing submitted campaign text. I don't mind my add being rejected because of grammar errors etc..I'm not that good in that department sometimes. (Or text that is sexually explicit.) 

But when my add is rejected for a few words that implied affection and desire by my two main characters. I thought you have to be kidding! I did my research prior to submitting my new campaign. And checked out what other author's add text said....far worse than mine! However these particular authors were making Amazon alot of money. I'm Not! Double standards! Unprofessional!

I contacted the review team via the support comment box and I was told each campaign text is reviewed on a case by case basis. And my add was declined for its implied sexual content. Hmm so if you make Amazon loads of money you get preferential treatment. And you can say whatever you want. The sexually  descriptive text I read when researching on Amazon book site was very racy.  My add text far from it.
Has any one else had issues with Amazon Marketing? 

I must add Support was very quick to respond to my concerns when I told them I was closing my account and I wanted my credit cards deleted. Otherwise there is no support!
title: “Amazon Marketing Review Team has Double Standards!”

I checked with the bank, the items were manually processed for payment at Amazon to my credit card prior to shipping.  They lie.  They bill before they ship.  Also I had an order cancel - and over 6 hours later, they billed my credit card and the email they sent on cancellation stated "Don't worry your not billed anyway until the order ships."  What a joke..  I don't like dishonest companies that lie and would not refer them to anyone for beans.  At least Ebay is honest and they don't lie.
title: “Don't shop Amazon - they lie - shop Ebay they don't lie”

content: Ordered a birthday present from them a year and a half ago.  Arrived on time, no complaints there.   BUT....   They apparently now follow me around everywhere I go, whether I want it or not.  Have never downloaded an app, I block cookies, but they do it anyway...  Earlier this year I wanted to research a small subculture in India, when suddenly a popup appeared from Amazon telling me they could sell me both a book and DVD about the group.  I called, complained.  They adamantly refused to tell me how to get rid of Amazon's installation, told me to call Apple.  Once in a while, I accidentally touch something on the tablet's keyboard and a long, vertical popup appears in lavender print, entirely in alphas aand numerics except for one word at the top:  Amazon.  So firstly there is this violation of privacy and secondly, why would I pay more plus shipping for the same thing I can get from a brick and mortar mom and pop locally?  I would never buy enough to want Prime, and they lost my patronage when I found out they spy on all my online activities.  It was creepy.  They charged more for that present than the local store, and charged more for shipping than if I did it myself.  I can't even go there to see what merchants sell, and then go directly to that merchant, because Amazon tracks me everywhere, apparently.  It was their stubborn refusal to tell me how to eject them from my tablet that concerns me.  By the way...  I just phoned Amazon to tell them that I am starting to warn people online about their invasion of privacy, and the first person that answered is a Filipino... I demanded to speak to an American that I could understand without a Creole accent.  I think Amazon should be hiring Americans, there are plenty of jobless Americans who have families to support, but Amazon is on the cheap and doesn't care about their own country.
title: “Creepy invasion of privacy”

content:
I'm not a huge Amazon shopper because their prices are generally higher than my other options but I always check.  I do have Prime and love using their music app.  I also like the movie and tv show apps and I even have a Fire Stick which is side loaded.  Customer service about order issues is great.  

As for shipping, I'm literate enough to understand that if something may not be in stock or that it may not be sorted into the warehouse yet and that there may be a delay and shipping times start when the packages ship.  If I am not a Prime member then I won't receive as fast of shipping because I can't get faster shipping than those who pay for the faster shipping option.  That would make no sense!  I know that a package isn't late until the expected delivery date has passed.  Amazon can shipping the day before the expected delivery date and still get it on time many times.  I know to double check the expected delivery date on the checkout screen as that will show me the date and if I choose to procede, that means I accept that day.  It does not mean I see the date but hope it arrives sooner and if it doesn't I throw a fit.  Also, this delivery date will tell me if a third party seller is in another country.  If the expected delivery date is a range of 2 weeks 3 weeks out, it is not in my country.

Amazon does have some add on only items.  These will only be able to be purchased with orders over $25 sold and fulfilled by Amazon.  It can include all add on only items.  These items aren't big sellers and cause losses by making them available to be a single item delivery.  Instead of increasing the price, they offer it as an add on item.  Would you drive 20 miles to the store to purchase a pack of gum?  Most add on only items have a list of other sellers on the right hand side.  These are either higher priced or have a shipping fee.  Sometimes the add on only item will ship by itself if it's in a different warehouse than the other items.  This doesn't make the add on only feature a waste.  That means the entire order made shipping and handling it not be a loss for them.

The rest of their customer service departments are not helpful.  Reports aren't taken seriously and often ignored.   They allow abuse in their forums and also allow some very nasty posts to be posted as well as bullying and public shaming while removing the dumbest of things.

There is a group of nasty, dirty, hateful old ladies and a some men that think these women are the fake photos they share who spend their entire day looking for reviews to make fun of.  They then share them on the forums so others can go look and downvote that reviewer.  They write nasty comments on the reviews and Amazon allows it.  People should not be afraid to write reviews.

Other forums are fool of the most disgusting posts with inappropriate language and subjects.  Amazon allows in even though it looks horrible on their behalf.  Is it that their reps don't understand English enough to know that eating poo isn't an appropriate topic.

Also, Amazon allows fake profiles that are attacking sellers and products for no good reason.  They write rude questions and reviews even though they don't own the products.  With heaps of evidence sent to them, they still let these nutjobs play on Amazon.

Lastly, Amazon is removing reviews and reviewing privileges of people they believe are violating their TOS but many people never violate their TOS and lose their reviews while people obviously violating their TOS and having been reported countless times are free to write their garbage reviews.

Amazon priorities are a total crapshoot.  After my Prime membership is up I am going to be cutting ties with Amazon because I won't be out anything.  I can get my items elsewhere with no problem.  They have gotten their priorities so out of whack lately and out sourcing their employees isn't helping them with these issues as they don't understand English when you contact them.
title: “Shopping ok, forums are disgusting”

content: When I first signed up for prime a few years ago, I just wanted it for the 2 day shipping because the rest of the benefits just seems meaningless to me or lame. You used to get everything in 2 days if you ordered by a certain time at the day. U see something like order by this time and get it by the day. That was always accurate. Now I always get super slow prime items, one recently ordered on a tuesday for a flash drive took until monday. and frequently my items take 4 days etc. these are not 3rd party sellers because i try to only buy from amazon directly to get the fastest shipping. they just simply arent fast or any good anymore or most importantly reliable. the worst part is before they used to try to be nice and give 1 month prime extensions and ive had people offer me 10 dollar refunds multiple times or the extensions but this was a long time ago. now they only make excuses and never do anything to make sure I am satisfied about my prime shipments being extremely late. I've exported my amazon purchases on my account and added them on excel and have spent like almost 10k dollars and you would think they would at least allow me to not have to pay 100 for this joke service on top of that. i do not recommend prime to anyone. if u are looking for 2 day shipping its not here. they do not care if u get it in 2 days or not and frequently u wont. could be 5 business days like mine took.
