content:
When using a mobile or tablet, you only receive a sub-set of the information you would normally receive when using a desktop.  Because of this, Amason's FREE super Saver delivery option becomes difficult to see - this means even if your purchase qualifies for free postage, Amazon will automatically charge you for postage and add it to the total to pay. 

Other sellers will zero postage costs automatically- Amazon DON'T - so watch out for this unwelcome increase, as it is very easy to overlook. Not only that, the delivery isn't any faster than if you selected the free option!

content: Over the past years Amazon has been my #1 site for online shopping. Recently I have heard negative reviews concerning this company. Some may be justified, some not. I recently read a negative concerning a hotel. The customer was not happy because the desk clerk did not smile.  I also feel the front desk should be friendly and welcoming, but this does not remove from the quality of the hotel. It probably means she doesn't like her job or is having a bad day. This person gave a poor rating on feeling not fact. Back to Amazon. Fact is, Amazon has always followed through with correcting the few problems I have encountered with vendors. One particular time Amazon did something which I could not believe. I was so pleased but felt they had gone way beyond the call to correct my complaint. This situation demonstrated to me, the professionalism and customer satisfaction Amazon is focused toward. I realize of the millions who order through Amazon, there will always be occasional negative issues to address and most are probably legitimate. But from my experience Amazon is still #1 online shopping site for me and my family.

I live in an apartment and have had my packages left in the mail room area. Where anyone can take it. Amazon will only replace a stolen item ONCE.

content:
I buy via Amazon about 3 times a month...I find them very good to compare similar products of what you are looking for, and narrow down a buying decision. I stay away from items that have a high chance of needing to be returned, so I do my research first to avoid the return-process. 
I also try to stick to products that Amazon themselves ships, so I have more predictability on how long it will take.
Up to now, have only returned one item out of many purchased...good track record for Amazon...return-process was smooth, but rather avoid it..
One of my few complaints about this site, is that many products are not displayed-photographed properly nor extensively, so often it's hard to see as much as I want to see; the whole idea of buying online is to be able to visualize what we are buying as best as possible, since we are not at a store actually seeing-feeling the product. Amazon could make the website more visually appealing and have their vendors improve the product representation in photos.
Another minor issue, is that the first thing I want to see from a vendor, other than feedback, is where do they ship from?( When not shipped from Amazon)...Amazon gives you the info, but not to handy (you have to dig for it).
Conclusion: I usually use Amazon for specific products that I've pre-decided I need and know something about (usually I check Ebay as well to compare)...I don't wander around just looking at products for shopping-fun, but rather chase specific product-needs I have determined (example: I need a spare camera battery for my Nikon: I go to Amazon first, and cross-check with Ebay prices. Eight out of 10 times I find Amazon offers better choices & service, and a simpler return-process if needed...
Example of an Amazon typical purchase of mine: camera lens...Best Buy has it at store for significantly more than Amazon...Ebay has a similar price but a vendor with feedback I don't care for...Amazon has it at a competitive price, and shipped-handled by Amazon: I buy it from Amazon.
Good site if you know what you want.
title: “Amazon is good to see product choices”

title: “Amazon Review”

content:
Dear Amazon,
You've changed. I miss who you used to be when you were young and insecure with your place in this world. Back when you refused to chase after others, but preferred to "innovate ahead" of them. We all got so used to your prices being the lowest, back when you'd undercut everyone, even to the detriment of your own balance sheets. You were such a risk-taker.

But you've long secured your place at the top of the e-commerce food chain, and your price points are creeping steadily upward as you continue to eat yourself. You're finding new ways to manipulate us into spending more in order to get free 2-day shipping. You've rolled out highly complex subscription programs that confuse and befuddle. You're trying to be Saks and Google and Apple and Netflix, etc.  all at once. But you've never been that cool, nor will you be. 

I'll never buy your fancy clothes, nor your failed smart phone (although if the price drops any further, I might pick one up as a toy for my 5-year-old nephew). But I will admit, with impunity, you're the first place I go when I know exactly what I need and I need it within 2 days.

Sorry for using you for your cheap and fast shipping. Sorry if I've reduced you to a booty call. Hope we can still see each other when it's right for both of us. 

XOXO,

jc
title: “Not as competitive as it used to be”

content:
I purchased Amazon Prime earlier this year for their guaranteed 3 day shipping. One of the items I purchased was lost in transit, this was told to me by the customer support gentleman I first spoke with. This gentleman also offered to refund me the original purchase and send me the same item (if i agreed to buy it again) with 1 day shipping. After being placed on hold for 20 minutes while the finalized the 2nd order I am told that 1 day shipping is not available for this item, and amazon is able to offer me a 5$ gift certificate for the hassle. 
I was already a little bothered that after 8 days I had to call for Amazon to tell me the package was lost. To then be offered a quick fix and then be told its not possible, brought me to a point of anger. 
Amazon needs to train their customer support team to better handle situations and use better wording when speaking to guests. As someone who works directly with clients, one of the basic rules in customer care  is to NEVER offer something you cannot guarantee and that is exactly what happened. The manager/supervisors solution was to extend my Prime membership an extra month.  Besides this one incident, Amazon has been able to deliver items within 3 days of purchase including Sundays. It's a good company and has its benefits as an frequent online shopper. I would suggest the customer service department receive extra training.
title: “lost item”

content: Amazon is as evil as any other huge American corporation, but when it comes to hard-to-find items at decent prices, it can't be beat. Their customer support is cumbersome, but at least it exists.

content:
I've had this card for 14 months and haven't encountered any issues. I'm a die-hard Amazon shopper, so I thought with 3 points for Amazon.com purchases, this is the card for me. Then I learned...

The 3 points only applies to Amazon.com purchases (plus a few other categories on Amazon.com, see below). Because so much of the merchandise on Amazon's site is not from "Amazon.com", but from affiliated and third party sellers, you may find that many of your purchases made on Amazon.com aren't really "Amazon.com" and therefore don't actually qualify for the 3 points. For instance, if you see items sold by Amazon Marketplace (which is common), beware, you'll just receive 1 point per dollar spent. I was so disappointed because the fine print (pasted below) isn't explicit about this, so I feel a little misled.
title: “It's okay, but beware of this”

content:
UPDATE, 2/27/16: 

Recently Amazon raised their minimum free shipping price from $35 to $49. Apparently it's a move to promote their $99/year Prime service, which I used on a free month's trial basis and did not like. They are going to lose a lot of business from me. $35 is reasonable if you want to buy one or two items, but I don't spend $49 every time I go shopping. 

Adios, Amazon.

_______________________________________________

MY ORIGINAL REVIEW, EDITED:

Amazon's merchandise is packaged well and shipped quickly, with very few exceptions.  If you have a problem, they work with you.  Their customer service and return policy are superior.  

Use caution when purchasing food products.  Consider the time of year, the vendor's reviews, and customer reviews.  You may not always be able to return edible items, but in one case I did get a refund because the product was completely disgusting.  Be polite and thorough in your reasons for returning anything, and there's often a chance Amazon will refund your money.
title: “Pushing the envelope too far on shipping”

content:
Amazon may be a great place to buy as a prime member, but the message boards are really poor to discuss in. With the "Do you think this post adds to the discussion" feature makes it an useless system wherever you go. It is the only system for their forums, but some kids had to abuse it just to make a fool out of themselves. Most forums don't have that feature.

Other than that, I was thinking of getting a fighting pad controller for the PS3. However, they ran out and it costs more than $35 to get it from... United Kingdom. Some prices of the products the other sellers handed out are more than their original prices. It's unbelievable to have Gears of War on the PC being sold secondhand for $33 on Amazon compared to $20 on Windows Games Live Marketplace.

What's good for me is the prime membership. They may give me free shipping, but I'm still furious with the warehouse deals selling a game "like new" for $33. Seriously, Jeff Bezos sold me the Kindle Fire, then trying to sell people with the HD version and now he wants to compete against Apple for a Kindle smartphone? He makes me laugh to ever think of going against the big two of the computer industry. They don't have a lot apps, but I'm sure they're a waste. I'm giving it a 3/5. The prime membership may be strong, but the customer services mentioned by others along with the buyers/sellers community are weak. I suggest not go to the discussion boards.
title: “Amazon may be a great place to buy as a prime member,...”

content: As a seller on Amazon I would say Amazon leads the pack with online scam! I get really good customer service and  almost always win any A to Z claim because I was so mad about so many buyers seeking free items and their money back.  I wrote to President Obama and file several Federal complaints. It is just aweful that the American people accept items and expect their money back as well. That is stealing! I always complained and let Jeff Bezos, CEO know I was an ethical seller and it was unethical the way Amazon just freely uses our money to give back to customer. Now I get really good customer service and if any customer complains, Amazon pays. That is not what a lot of sellers can say even sellers who make more than a half a million do not receive good customer care from Amazon. I will say the buyers are much more serious as well and will pay for expensive items more readily than any other e-commerce site I have ever sold on, in my humble opinion. I like to sell on Amazon better now than when we first started. I wish to see some other e commerce site come about and be a good competitor of Amazon because they are growing too fast and too powerful for their own good. If you see the reviews probably all buyer give so many five star reviews if it were sellers they would give it 2 stars.
title: “Amazon is Good but there is a lot of Scam!”

content:
To date I haven't had a problem returning an Amazon product within the return window and sometimes I've been giving extended time to do so. But to my surprise I've bought a few bad items based on FAKE 5 or 4 star reviews. Some of those reviews stick out easly due to them having the same typo error patterns. 
Example:  "love this.great product." Or "bought two.love it."

I have also noticed "Bad" reviews that were fake. They sometimes name another product they say is better. Some are being done by competiting companies and about 95% are not from Verified Buyers. Within the comment section under a bad review is where I first noticed a FAKE bad review. The sellers would be trying to resolve the issue and the customer seem to not want any type of resolution not even in returning the product. The seller claimed that the buyer was not a real buyer and that it was a fake review and all the customer had to do is return the product but they have no product to return. I'm sure the ones I've read like this we're fake. 

My advise is to make sure the reviews are Verified reviews. I don't trust all of those either but this is a good place to start. Read and ask plenty of questions in the Q&A. Read through the good and bad reviews. Check comments to see if the seller responded to any of the bad reviews
title: “Be Aware of Fake Reviews......”

content:
I am not a speed reader, but I do read a lot of books. I get content for my Kindle app from several different places, including Amazon.com.
Content (as long as it is in a format used by the Kindle app) can be sent to Amazon.com and registered in their cloud storage for free. I've been a member of Amazon since 2012 and have sent over 2,500 different .mobi, .pdf and.epub files to be stored in the Kindle cloud.
Unfortunately, today I found out that Amazon/Kindle can't find much of the content I've sent/registered with them. Amazon insists all my content is still registered and available but can only find 357 different files. (This "lost" content is the reason Amazon.com doesn't get 5 stars from me.)
title: “Amazon is good!”

content:
Shipping can be pricey, but orders are handled very efficiently - provided there are no requests attached.
Amazon does not respond to special requests, like delayed shipping - you place the order, payment is approved, and the goods are on the way.
Customer  service can be time-consuming, as you do not deal with a single person, if you need to make multiple contacts.
overall, a good organisation to deal with when you are up to play with the system.
title: “Be Sure, to be sure!”

content: I live so far away from my grown children.  I love ordering off of Amazon and having the packages sent to them direct.  No mailing hassles on my part.
title: “Keep up the good work”

content:
90% of the time, I am completely satisfied with Amazon.  The most common issue I have is shipping, I've ordered things with free 2 day shipping that have always arrived when expected, but other things I've ordered with standard shipping, seem to sit in a warehouse somewhere until shipping time estimate arrives, causing late arrival more often than pleases me.  I believe they do this to try to incentivise customers into joining Prime or paying higher rates for shipping priority.  I've handled shipping and receiving duties during my career and sales that would have gone to Amazon lately, have gone elsewhere that handle S/H more the way I always did.  
For a positive note, I only have received one order, in the several years I've been a customer, that didn't meet my expectations due to a missing part, but the cost of getting it on my own was less than the hassle of dealing with Amazon on the issue.
title: “Generally very good service”

content: I have ordered many things from Amazon. I have had two issues where I had to get a replacement item for defective electronics and when I notified them of the problem they had the supplier contact me via email and once I told the vendor(s) the problem they sent replacements no charge and I didnt even have to send the defective unit back. My only gripe is that they dont accept PayPal
title: “I found that Amazon is very reliable”

content: I love the convenience of online shopping and Amazon Prime was always my go to shopping, but recently Prime has been quite unreliable. Took me two hours of customer support to get this one resolved as the specific model I needed was no longer in stock and I had already built the framing for it in my camper. It was eventually resolved amicably, but shopping shouldn't be this hard. Still plan on shopping with Amazon but dropped the Prime. Just isn't worth it to me anymore.

content:
I had the wonderful opportunity to join Amazon this year. My husband and I wanted to change one of our viewing services to something different to get more of the variety we were hoping for. Im so happy we did. The shows and viewing options are awesome, but they are just the tip of the iceberg. Free 2 day shipping has saved us so many times when we needed something very fast. Weve discovered if you can wait just a few days more, usually Amazon will give you a small credit toward one category or another and they can add up and allow you to get some fun things. 
I keep hearing people describe the features Amazon had before I joined and I really feel like I missed out on some very fun options like being able to get a large variety free books to read every month. I love what Im seeing but I havent heard anything about new features that were comparable to what was taken away. Its unusual to see a company cut back on what they offer instead of adding to it or changing it to something comparable. 
Still, this is the Amazon I know, and although the removed features sound like they could make it even greater, I still enjoy what they do offer. I suppose ignorance is bliss as long as they hold off on removing features Im getting used to having with them.
title: “Love Amazon Prime, whist theyd stop taking features”

content: good shop website,i have buy customized tshirt in this website and very satisfied it,Amazon used to be amazing. That is before the out of country and scammers got involved. I've had numerous orders not show up and told was delivered but when I checked the address wasn't mine.

content: I order from Amazon very often, at least once a month. I love the selection of items that I can browse. I've ordered everything from shoes to make up. I am not a Prime member, but I should really sign up, as they have great perks for shoppers. If the item I order is shipped by Amazon, it's pretty much guaranteed that the order will arrive within a few days. But if its offered by a sub contractor it may take a little longer. I have only had one bad experience with a shipment. I ordered an eye shadow palette that arrived broken. I snapped a pic and sent it to the seller and my Amazon account was credited that day. So I love Amazon!

title: “I've found better”

content: Unlike ebay they deliver as promised.I will continue to use Amazon but never ebay.--------------------------------------------------

content:
The return process is exceptional. All you have to do is locate the order on your account, hit return items and they send you a return label which you can just print off through your email. Then you stick it on there and ship it back no hassle. They also give you plenty of time to send your items back out. Instead of the normal 2-3 business days most places give you. You don't have to talk to a customer service rep at all and you don't have to send out emails and wait for a response. You also do not have to wait for your refund;  as soon as you drop your return off at the ups or local post office and they scan it in, you get your full refund. 

The customer service if you do decided to call is complicated and they mess up your orders hard core if you need something changed. I placed 2 orders and needed to cancel one so I called the phone line and asked them to cancel it. They cancelled the wrong one so I had to call back again and cancel everything because the rep was confused and didn't know what he was doing.Then It was a fight and alot of confusion about the refund for the orders. I guess it all worked out in the end but I didn't re order the purchase I had originally wanted to keep. Instead of cancelling an order it is easier to have it sen to you and do process a refund. It is much easier. They also have a lot of fake reviews on items but they are pretty easy to spot. 

Other than that I use amazon for alot. Love it.
title: “Use them all the time.”

content: Here you can find almost everything. Prices are a bit on the expensive side, especially with electronics devices and music. If you're and avid reader you can fin lots of books at a very cheap price! It's very easy to find good products at a good price.

content:
The reviews from third party sellers may be biased. I just received an email from a 3rd party seller, Mambate, asking me to post a review on Amazon and providing me with the url to do so, on a beach tent I had just bought from them via Amazon. It advised me to only do so if I was satisfied, otherwise to respond directly to them. I emailed customer service at Amazon asking if this was condoned and/or prevalent and what action they would take.

Try emailing customer services at Amazon. You can simply cannot. There is a lengthy procedure but no options for general points like this

So.. two things. Their reviews from 3rd parties may be highly biased and when you try to be ever so helpful by forwarding a copy of the 3rd party's email to Amazon, you cannot do so and have to resort to this. Maybe Amazon will read it.

And, think of an opinion poll on whether Americans approve of Trump, asking them only to respond if they are satisfied. It really is terrible.
title: “Reviews may be biased”

If it weren't for this, Amazon would earn five stars from me...I buy lots of used CDs and books (third party sellers are almost ALWAYS faster shippers than Amazon) and the few returns I've had have been processed quickly.  As good as it is, the shipping thing sticks in my craw...

They are often forgetting to mention if an English language DVD has subtitles (required to follow some plots and nerdy dialogues).  It's just a bit harder to collect the vital statistics for a prospective purchase regarding publication data, abridgement, photos, translators. I could approach suppliers for the details but in the past I could usually get them from the Amazon descriptive entry or sometimes by looking at the book cover thumbnail. content: I don't find the website that easy to use when you are looking for something specific and trying to figure out who to buy from. Ebay is much easier to know who the seller is and be able to check them out and communicate with them before buying. Amazon is mostly just find it and buy it - it takes a lot of tracking to ask about an item or check into the seller if you can even figure out who the seller is. I like to just buy directly from Amazon and I only buy products I am already familiar with so I know what to expect. Amazon return is easy but if you return for anything other than broken product, you will have to pay the return shipping so it isn't a place you want to try new products out like pet food or buy clothes you aren't sure the size of for that manufacturer unless you don't care about paying to return something. Unless you are prime which I wouldn't know about, shipping can take a long time for certain things. I've had to wait a few days even before my item shipped, as though Amazon was trying to order it to sell to me after I bought it, but they tell you right up front it will be a few days before it ships & then when it does ship, it gets to you fast. The prices are high. I find a lot of things cheaper elsewhere but if you only like to shop in the same place and don't have time to shop around for better prices - you can pretty much find what you want in Amazon as long as it is still manufactured and sold. Otherwise you have to rely on Ebay for hard to find or out of production items & hope someone is selling theirs or stocked up and has some to spare. The thing I use Amazon for the most is product reviews. Whether I am buying from Amazon or not , I never make a big purchase and sometimes don't make a small purchase without first seeing if their are any Amazon reviews. I figure some of them are fakes and self serving but trust the majority of them because you have to have an Amazon account to review & they also show the verified purchasers. Anyhow whether you like or not its a massive online force that isn't going anywhere.
title: “SIte could be better but the service is ok”

content:
Some of my best experiences have been with amazon.com!!
 I love the fact that as I established myself with this online business I started getting my return refunds to me the same day I shipped a return back!! Even when I first started returning items it would only take about a full budiness week before my refund showed up on my account which wasn't too bad either!
 I've gotten Great Deals On various things that have really made my life easier. I love the fact that I have access to bulk items on almost anything!! Now I've become addicted to comparison shopping in the stores like Wal-Mart, Whole Foods, Ulta, etc for my beauty supplies essential oils. I go on to amazon.com and see if I can get it for better price and oftentimes I can!! especially when it comes to hard-to-find items like essential oils,shipping boxes ,shipping supplies, certain discontinued fragrances/ perfumes, cosmetics , etc. these items are almost always cheaper on Amazon!

I love that the return procedure is easy too. I can drop off my returns at my local Staples that has a UPS drop off on site.
I love the fact that even though I refuse to pay for Prime which is $99 a year they still have thousands of items that offer free shipping with a minimum purchase so if there are several items I plan on buying and they all offer free shipping with a minimum I usually end up getting free shipping anyway so for me it's always great!!
Sometimes I wait until I need a couple of things that allows me to meet the minimum and then I get free shipping without spending $99 a year which I'm sure pays for itself in the long run for consistent. but I'm one of those people that just never knows when I'm going to be shopping on Amazon! sometimes I shop every 3 months sometimes I find something i love every month and sometimes I can go 6 months without making a purchase !! especially if I buy a lot at one time I might only shop 3-4 times a year so on average paying $33  for free shipping kind of doesn't work out for me BUT if you're someone who constantly shops then the $99 is probably worth it!

 the only criticism I have of Amazon is that I wish they would get rid of those overseas Chinese based businesses that sell clothing that are so far off the u.s. sizing that every other review i read is negative about buyes ending up having to return the item because it fit horribly or was made from super cheap material.  
Often times the return cost was so much it paid to just keep the item !! which is very disappointing so I always have to check to see if the sizing is US or a Chinese conversion chart because that right away is a red flag for me!
If they got rid of those sellers I think it help. They don't need subpar cheap items being sold through their site  you can only hurt them in the long run bc I've heard plenty of people who were thinking they were getting this amazing bargain and great fashion ended up with this super cheap stuff plus arriving from overseas sometimes takes weeks!! and when the item finally arrives and it's two and three sizes too small.
I've only bought one item that I knew was not from a us-based manufacturer. I decided to take a chance because I had been looking for this item and of course when I got it not only was it super small but it was defective because there was no button hole for the button!!!which was hilarious and proof positive to me that I need to stay away from those companies!
 but other than that great experience every time
title: “Love Amazon!”

content: Amazon is a great place to get what you need at a great price.  Their customer service is great.  You can get products that you need at great prices and Amazon stands behind everything they sell.  However, like eBay, Amazon is notorious for scalpers who buy products and then resale them for hundreds over MSRP due to shortage of these items.  Apple products and Nintendo products come to mind... If you want something, be sure to purchase them from legitimate sellers.  Don't fall for scalpers which Amazon should not allow.  That is the reason I deduct a point from this review.  Scalpers are the reason why we can't buy products at the MSRP prices... they buy up the supply dry and resale them for much higher prices.  If Amazon and eBay don't allow these scalpers to do business on their sites, consumers would still have a chance to buy these at fair prices.
title: “Buy from Amazon.  Beware of scalpers”

content:
I've been an Amazon Prime member for years, and up until recently I've been 100% satisfied with it. Recently, Amazon has started using something called "Share Post" for their shipments and it sucks.  They ship UPS to the local Post Office and drop the shipments so the post office will be responsible for the remainder of the delivery. I guess it's cheaper, but I recently had 5 different shipments get lost in that process.  For people who live on rural routes, you can't use the street address which is required by UPS; instead you have to list the PO box because the post office doesn't do home delivery in certain areas.

It wouldn't be such a big deal if, during the ordering process, there was a disclaimer notifying the buyer which form of delivery was being used.  That way the proper address (street or PO Box) could be listed and there wouldn't be this confusion.
title: “Convenient shopping but need more transparency on shipping”

content:
Pros
1) Amazon Prime offers free 2-day shipping for many products.
2) Amazon Prime offers some free music and movies.
3) Amazon Prime offers free returns for some items and the return methods are hasslefree.

Did you notice something? Yeah, Amazon rocks when you have Prime membership. However, the membership fee is high.

Cons:
1) Sometimes 2-day shipping fails to deliver in two days.
2) Amazon Prime only offers very limited choices for free music and movies, considering the membership fee.
3) Amazon Prime does not cover free returns for all Prime eligible items. For instance, I needed an immune boost product when I was very sick, but the item was delivered on the third day. I couldn't wait and got something else. However, the item delivered was not eligible for free returns.
4) There are more and more products on Amazon that are sold and shipped by sellers in China. The quality of these items is very questionable most of the time, and the shipping time is ridiculously long. I'm not saying we shouldn't purchase anything from China, but that being said, at least it should have a filter function for buyers to choose. I purchased a fall dress for my daughter and it didn't tell me where the item will be shipped from nor give me a tracking number, so I waited for over a month (already lost track of time since it took too long -- maybe 5~6 weeks) to receive it. The weather was already winter-like around Thanksgiving, so I don't see the point of keeping the dress as my daughter will outgrow it very soon. Bummer!!
5) The search engine of Amazon fails to deliver only the results you want -- it somehow gives a lot of junks when crossing your key words, and I don't know why. On the contrary, I feel eBay does a better job on this.
6) Amazon should make itself more visible on Google shopping if its search engine has flaws. It is very frustrating to be not able to find the real products neither from Amazon nor Google shopping.

Due to the reasons above, I'm giving 3 or 4 stars for Amazon.
title: “Good only when you have Prime”

It is SO nice to order some things on Amazon, and then not have to pay anything at all!  You cannot beat that with a stick, as they say.

Ordering things online at Amazon, at usually the best or really close price, with free shipping, is really good for me, as I really do live out in the "sticks", and it is a bit of a drive to shop for anything.  I must say at least 4 plus stars!

content: I want you to thoroughly read my review before down voting it leaving a negative comment. No doubt Amazon is one of the finest online shopping stores. content:
I have 2 major problems with Amazon and those are:
1:  I am an Amazon Prime member yet I pay 100$(basically) to be so while they do promotions for new people to join for half the rate.  I believe Prime members should get a deal from that as well.  We've been loyal to Amazon and it is unfair to charge newbies way less than we pay yearly.  Maybe they could lower or give a small/whatever refund for those promotions to current Amazon Prime members.
2:  Another Prime issue.  I'm paying so much for Prime, but I can't watch my films in HD because they won't change their player.  It's so annoying to watch shows in standard when you're paying for HD and I'm not going to switch to other browsers every time I want to watch a show that happens to be on Amazon.
3:  (Not a MAJOR issue, but an issue none-the-less.  Amazon seems to be very pricey and just to keep getting more and more so even for Prime members.  Usually what's on Amazon, I can get MUCH cheaper on Ebay or some other site.
4:  Please check the reviews people give for items and movies because some times they are NOT reviewing the item, but the seller.  This totally ruins the review value.  I can't trust the overall review because some idgit is saying "they sent the box to me bent"....that has ZERO to do with the product at hand.  Someone really needs to get on that one.

Pluses and why it got a 4 star:  
1:  The free shipping is awesome.  I love not having to deal with that.  
2:  The majority of the time their customer service is excellent...like the best.  Only one time did I have to deal with a bad one and I just went to another one and they fixed my problem pronto. 
3:  It has a lot of Prime freebies that I love (but it could stand to make some more of it's movies and TV shows free for Prime Members).
4:  It's pretty easy to navigate.
5:  I bought a 6 cartridge litter box from members on the site two times and I was sent ONLY ONE two times....Amazon refunded me and let me keep the one that I did get instead of forcing me to go through the trouble of sending it back when it was a huge error on the side of the seller and the boxes are quite large.  It would've been too much of a waste of my time.  I paid over 70$ each time for 6 boxes.
title: “It Is Great, But It Could Be Amazing”

content:
I have Amazon Prime and it makes shopping on this website even better. I occasionally compare deals on Amazon and eBay, and retail stores to see which have better prices. Sometimes, Amazon isn't the most inexpensive, but if there's a situation that an item is, the Prime Shipping is extremely useful. The customer service is very helpful. It's overall a very friendly experience and extremely easy to use. There are some minor things I'd like to mention:

1. Pet Items: Maybe not just this category, but there are items that cannot be returned with no explanation. When I called up customer service, a CSR told me that some items "just can't be returned" even if the return policy never said anything about that. I asked him if there's a way to tell (for next time) and he tells me "no". Why? That's just strange and inconvenient.

2. Seller: If you think Amazon is more generous to you than eBay as a seller, they're not. They have their own policy to refund buyers for any reason just like eBay. Fees are not much less, although it depends on the category. Ebay is just a flat 15% (plus Paypal fees), so Amazon may win on the fee calculations. But, don't expect all buyers to be reasonable as I realize Amazon customers assume that there are no third-party sellers and are often impatient, demanding and hostile when there's an issue; even more hostile than eBay buyers.

3. There really should be a non-Add-On and a non-Amazon Fresh price. I wanted to purchase two different items that were only Add-On and Amazon Fresh. No other listing offers it even if it meant raising the price. Really disappointing; I wouldn't have mind to pay extra.

4. Two-Day Prime Shipping does NOT include the handling time, which can range anywhere between 1-5 days. I purchased an item that took 5 days to "handle" and then two days Prime shipping.

Honestly, I could get amazing prices for certain items on Amazon, and best of all, some retail stores price-match if its shipped and sold by Amazon. I have used this website consistently every month for random purchases. There are really good prices and other times, maybe not so much. Its definitely worth having around.
title: “Good Website”

content: It never fails Amazon and Ebay always pull through,Always very prompt service, Can't go wrong.

content: Good morning fellow  jabbers.  I want to give you the follow up on Amazon.  I was contacted by several people from Amazon.  First there was Jada a a lazy lazy non caring who wanted me to do all the leg work then she would perhaps be able to help me.  Next came Linda an excellent Amazon employee who knows how to treat Amazon  customers.  She asked me for nothing, took the initiative to rectify the problem.  Ordered me a new car cover.  Spoke to me like I had a BRAIN.  An example of an employee who goes the extra mile to assist the customer.  KUDOS TO LINDA (Customer rep.)  And KUDOS to Amazon for having the sense  to hire Linda. I am once again a satisfied customer..  THANK YOU FELLOW JABERS FOR READING MY STORY.  GOD BLESS EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU.  Dallas Yvonne
title: “Amazon comes through”

content: I do probably 90% of my shopping on Amazon. It is always my first stop for anything I need. I love the prices. I like that part of my purchase goes to my favorite charity.  I like not having to go to a store - or several - to get what I need.  I like the fast delivery rates and the subscription services for things I need regularly.  My ONLY complaints, which is why it's only 4 stars instead of 5, are (1) they seriously waste a LOT of supplies packing small items in large boxes and not combining orders to a single address and (2) over the past two years, the rate of errors, non-delivery, and defective items has increased dramatically.  I realize that it is due to the volume but, given that, I think they need to re-visit their return and replacement policies because its become very hard to get replacements and/or refunds when something goes wrong for most of the things I buy.  Still the biggest bang for my buck online as far as I'm concerned.
title: “Not perfect, but light years better than most”

content:
I purchased a phone for my son that became defective within 7 months.  Amazon wanted to only give me a partial refund.  My state has an implied warranty law, the Attorney General did a tv segment stating that no need for extended warranty, and if companies don't honor the state warranty, they are in non-compliance.  It took me a while and also had to provide the law and they finally refunded the full amount.   

For the most part I have had good luck, and not to many issues with needed to use refunds or replacement.  

I have noticed of late the prices on some of the products are far more expensive than many brick and mortar stores, so check prices before you buy on Amazon.  I still check reviews out of products I am interested in.  The problem today is now they have people who get free items to review them, makes me wonder how legit the review is.
title: “Sometimes it is hard to get a refund.”

content:
i buy a lot of stuff from this site, but i find more often then not the shipping is the most irritating process. especially now that you have to buy $49 worth of stuff to get free shipping. 

when you order something, i find when its free shipping, that it will often take an entire week before they get around to ordering it and sending it. i live near a hub, i should be able to get it all much faster. i'm certain they do this to make the prime look better, but i think that's over priced. unless i'm shipping bags of cement and tires, i don't think i'll ever get to a $100 in shipping. 

another thing is the cart, while it will hold your items forever, if its out of stock, it kicks it out, i've almost forgotten to order important things because it did do that. and when it does do that, and you add it back to the cart, it may not be from the same company. it might be more money, or it may be used (as one item they sent me was).

searching is becoming much harder, it finds things i never typed in. i would rather see - we could not find that exact item, here are some things related to it. but more times than not it will show totally random things. they use titles as keywords, and many people spam them.

they allow reviews from anyone - even people who never bought it - always make sure it says - verified, or you may be seeing a fake review.

they do have a great refund policy though, they have come through each time. but its tricky to find their contact some times.

---Mike Savad
http://www.MikeSavad.com
title: “i have mixed thoughts about this place”

content:
I am an Amazon fan. I live in a small town and for exotic items like a stainless steel pet fountain, or electronic items I need to go on line. Amazon has the best prices, and for prime members, often free shipping. The items arrive timely are well packaged. I can usually find used goods in very good conditions. It's better than driving 80 miles round trip to the nearest city and run to 3-4 stores only to find they don't have what I'm looking for in the price range I'm willing to spend.

I do not like what I am reading about how they treat their employees. As a former employer I know that the bottom line is not the only measuring stick of a business. I won't shop at WalMart because of their unethical business practices. If Amazon continues down this path of employee exploitation I may have to look elsewhere to shop. We vote with our dollars and approval of unethical business practices should not be tolerated.
title: “Great place to shop for almost everything. Concerned about their employee practices.”

You pay more on Amazon but it's worth it for fast delivery and great customer service if something goes wrong

content:
I still trust Amazon, don't get me that wrong. But, I am discovering that sellers I prefer are having to go it alone because Amazon costs too much for all their bloated commercial overload. Like buying a car downtown is more expensive than out in the next small town where the commercial overhead is lower, and the car prices are lower, and the salesman is more friendly.

So, Amazon may well be headed in the same downward commercial spiral Google and ebay are going down in.

I hope not.
title: “Amazon Is Getting Less Customer-Focused, More Like Google”

content:
I've rarely had an issue with anything I bought on Amazon, and when I did, they resolved in really quickly. My only negatives are that not everything is available via Prime, and Amazon is definitely NOT always the most economical option...but you pay for the convenience of having things delivered to your door, I guess. 
My other issue is with selling books on Amazon. I've done this for several years with little problems, but recently, I listed a pair of books that were brand new, but had been at a bookstore for a long time and never sold. The ISBN showed the publishing date, and I stated the year of publication in the listing details. Both books dealt with professional photography, and the contents were still valid. The buyer got all bent out of shape about the fact that books were older (although they were brand spanking new) and complained to Amazon...who found in his favor. He got his money back, and was to return the books to me, but he never did that, and Amazon did nothing about it. Seems they're like eBay, and all about the buyers, but want to do nothing for sellers.

content:
I have found the reviews and the review system on Amazon to be a great help in understanding many products and services.  If I take the time to read what regular people have to share, I usually always learn something new and useful.  The problem with the internet is that it is a bottomless pit of raw info and has very little context and wisdom is hard to find.   Without wisdom, we are all shooting in the dark. 

The availability of real user reviews and people's real opinions, as various as they are, is a small ray of light in a dark forest.   Since everyone sees things from a different perspective, it is often difficult to weed out the truth about something, but if you read enough comments, sometimes patterns start to emerge.   No other company offers as much depth in actual user comments, although this site, sitejabber, is a notable exception.
People have wisdom and most people are decent.   If all companies allowed us the freedom to exchange our honest experiences, and the software would allow us to search a little better and also to collate the results, it would be a good day for consumers and a bad day for ruthless companies selling low quality trash.   So my Hat is off to Amazon.  There is a reason most people use them and that is because they are the most reputable company out there.   If other companies followed their example, it would be a better world.
title: “regarding Amazon reviews, not all it could be, but the best out there.”

content:
I am a U.S. citizen that is retired and living in Mexico. Amazon has a site here amazon.com.mx but it is really bad. The prices are sky-high as compared to the U.S. site and many things are listed as not available/out-of-stock.

The thing is I have frequent family visits so I buy things on the U.S. site and have stuff brought down. Their international shipping rates aren't bad either if I need something "now" but quite a few things they won't ship to Mexico.

The one thing that pisses me off is I have to use my family's credit cards as my credit cards are Mexican and are in pesos. Amazon gives very unfair exchange rates when they convert from U.S. dollars to Mexican pesos.

Having said all that, they have everything, their prices are good, their Website is very well designed and easy to use, they are nice people in my experience and have excellent Support. I didn't rate them perfect because of the exchange rate issue, but they really are a good company to work with.

content:
I've made a number of purchases on Amazon India and about 80% of my experiences have been very positive. Mostly the products are as promised and arrive quickly. In one or two cases they outer packaging of the items was peeling or dingy, but the products themselves were good. When I did receive damaged products or I didn't receive the products I had paid for, I contacted Amazon customer care and they immediately refunded my money. Only two points of improvement for Amazon India:
1) Many of the prices on your site are so obnoxiously, ridiculously high. I'm talking about pricing something that sells in the US for $10 (~600 rupees) at Rs.20,000. I waste time on your site because so many of the products I want are at these "scammy" prices. Ruins the whole shopping experience and makes me feel like I'm in some cheap fake marketplace full of scamsters look to swindle customers.
2) It is very hard to contact Amazon Customer Care. The first time I did it, it took me 30 minutes to figure out how to email/chat with customer care. There needs to be a prominant link for that.
title: “Great Customer service (often stupid prices)”

content:
There is this flaw in the instant pay system. If during the previous 60 days you accidentally included some item in your shopping cart, which you did not in fact purchase, the next time you purchase anything these items magically re-appear and if you are not very careful you will pay for them!

They also take no responsibility for most 3rd party sellers which has become most of the business.

The function which suggest other products based on previous purchases actually works and I find it more helpful than others.
title: “Perfect 80% of the time”

They also have a department to monitors your account to make sure there is no fraudulent activity.  Without my knowledge they actually caught someone using my payment account, shipping somewhere I never have and immediately disabled this payment account.  When I discovered the activity the informed me what had happened, told me to contact creditor and that they would issue a credit when contacted.  I did as told and everything was resolved without any problems. What more can your ask for.Great fraud department service.

content:
I have never made a better decision about something, I just had to come back and share. Before I bumped into Glestore Men's 3-pack Modal Soft Boxer. I was looking for something that could enable me to be free and yet give me assurance that I'm totally covered- you know, without having to remind me I'm carrying a package when I walk and this babie right here was designed just for that! I have to admit that the quality is at its best, the design that takes the body's nature, not to mention the price. They had all these different sizes and colours to choose from so i didn't have to try so hard to find something ideal. With a smart combination of 95% Modal and 5% spandex the absorption capacity is quite high, even higher than cotton fiber which is about 50%, i have done a couple of wears but so far not felt suffocated or soaked, even during my work-outs they have proven to be breathable, this definitely spells quality and for me to place my wallet on a product, there has to be some good quality in it.

These underwear have been nothing short of comfortable, and quite soft which is a great feeling not having to be coursed by rough jeans, they are also slim fit and can be worn under any material. Though I'm kind of wondering what you had in mind for us with this product because it falls more on the sexy side which is a plus anyway, because either way you look good both with and without pants. They also cover a good section of the thigh and in them I don't even feel close to naked. It's almost like wearing a second skin but with a good fitting for your junk, meaning good chocolate with a good wrapper.

The waist is another thing that really got points from me, it's firm but not too tight and the fitting's perfect especially around the groin. I have bought a few different brands before that I won't mention here for obvious reasons but some of them actually make you feel like you're wearing a female swimsuit--and sadly, I kid you not. I have seen far more expensive brands, this kind of explains why a lot of females have a notion on men scratching their 'groins' publicly, the itching comes as a result of wearing underwear that's too tight which would obviously bring that region too close to the body, which should not happen anywhere in the face of the universe-no really, it shouldn't. This also does not mean they should be let to hang free for reasons best known to us. All men irrespectable of their social standing, lifestyle, political power, age or.. or.. forget it, deserve good quality, well-fitting underwear and the Glestore Mens 3-pack modal Soft Boxer provided just that for me.

In my experience-that is; since I started buying underwear on my own which is a long while, i have so far not found few that can compete with the comfort of your everyday wear of Glestore Mens 3-pack Modal Soft Boxer. At first I tried this brand out with a 1-pack but it obviously didn't take long to purchase the 3-pack. One thing that probably sucks about my life is that I actually don't have enough time for some of these little but time consuming chores so I was very glad it turned out to be machine washable, (can't do it most of the time) but presumably just a few machine washes and mostly hand washing we'll do, but that definitely worked for me.

These days it's very rare to get anything good with an affordable price tag but your prices are like hitting the jackpot, the average cost of the Glestore Mens 3-pack Modal Soft Boxer ranges from about $6 to $9 on average. I found this price very fair to say the least and this partly gave me all the more reason to buy these superior undies. The return policy for some sizes is quite cool if for example someone bought a pair or more but the wearer was not present or aware during purchase, I guess they'd most certainly have to be unsealed at return but nevertheless I'm glad I went shopping around and discovered something different and unique. This product is the best bet you have in the male category and I will definitely be making future purchases if you keep both the quality and the price unbeatable.

Hope my words can help you guys to find your style.
Thank you.
title: “Glestore Mens 3-Pack Modal Soft Boxer Briefs”

content: It had always been so very easy to manage my Kindle Fire content, borrowing and purchasing  e-books, audio-books, downloading apps., etc.., Until this past month when I got in touch with Amazon regarding deleting some e-books, audio-books, hypnosis & meditations that I had purchased recently and several years ago.  My storage space is running low and since all of the above mentioned items had previously been read/listened to as a medical condition reduces the amount of time I can read. printed text.  Unfortunately, every inquiry that was sent Amazon (about permanently deleting the books) has been sent to Audible who has no idea how to remove the content.  My only option at this point would be to delete my Kindle Fire content completely and start from scratch -- that would entail my de-registering my Kindle Fire and re-purchasing the e-books, Audio-books, hypnosis and meditations that I still want and listen to.  This has been an ongoing inquiry for well over a month and I'm getting absolutely nowhere, prior to Audible's involvement in this "immersion reading" nonsense, there was no problem at all with managing my content myself through Amazon's web site. The problem appears to be that the items being referred to were prior to Audible's involvement with Amazon books and they really do not know how to delete content.  Guess they didn't think that far ahead -- did they -- Thanks2Net ??
title: “Amazon audio-books and listening great -- UNTIL Audible got involved.”

content:
I have used Amazon on multiple occasions, generally with great success. The site is very easy to use with an enormous number of products to browse, meaning it is often my first port of call.
With the exception of one product and another that failed to arrive (although the seller agreed to send another), I have been delighted with all of my purchases. The one issue I had with the company itself was probably my own fault, but is something anyone reading should be aware of. If you become a Prime member on the 3 day free trial (which I clicked on by accident), and then do not cancel this at the end of the complimentary period; you become a full member and are charged for the privilege. I may have been informed of this at some point and just failed to read it though.

content: Amazon isn't just a place to shop online, it is a resource. I used it research products, and I rely on the reviews of books, which represent individual and independent opinion. Yes, there are a lot of reviews that are just stupid, but if you read the critically, there is a lot to be learned. When I look at a book the first thing that I do is to look at the one-star reviews. If all the bad reviews are ideologically motivated, that is a reason to take the better reviews seriously. If the bad reviews are well thought-out, detailed, and carefully reasoned, then all the predictable rave reviews are probably mere fluff.
title: “A resource”

I order from Amazon monthly.  Amazon and its sellers are very reliable, including their adequate packing of fragile items that is most important to me.  Incredibly fast delivery time, beating walmart.com by miles in this regard.  

Wish that delivery costs from outside businesses to Prime customers were more lucid.  Buyers must go back and forth adding and removing item from cart to compare shipping costs.  

After buying two energy saving toilets on a tax-free weekend, sent email to Jeff Bezos about removing local sales tax from order.  Received a reply that refund would be issued, though this never happened.  This is a minor complaint, considering   great products are received without damage, quickly, and at a great price.

content:
Amazon is a great way to shop for products.  I have personally never had a problem shopping here.  The only problem I had with an order was that it took a very long time to arrive.  It apparently came from China.

Anyways, as much as Amazon can be a great place to shop, KNOW YOUR PRICES.   Just because an item is being sold on Amazon does not mean it is a good deal.

I have seen some products being sold for more than they could be purchased elsewhere.

For example, I buy my health and wellness products direct from the manufacturer. People are selling the same products for 300% - 400% markup.  That's REDICUOUS!  

For example, I purchase a super high quality moisturizer for under $10.  The product has been clinically proven to be 7 times better at holding moisture than Eucerin.  The problem is that the product is being sold on Amazon for over $30???!??  Sure people are buying it for that price because the product is great, but I would rather keep my money by buying it direct from the manufacturer, thank you very much.
title: “Great way to save money, but be careful!”

content:
As somebody who only purchases items from Amazon themselves (no third party sellers), I am disapointed with the amount of counterfeit items i have received. Do yourself a favor, and buy things that are easily counterfeit ( phone cases, sd cards, earbuds etc) in person. 
I purchased three Speck branded phone cases from amazon. They were of decent construction, but two of them cracked after being dropped from about knee height. I sent them back to speck because they were supposed to be under warranty. Speck called me and told me to send them back to who i bought them from because they were fakes. Its funny, Amazon would not take them back. Their reasoning? They do not allow returns on counterfeit goods.
I purchase many things from amazon. My experience with counterfeits has not soured my overall experience with Amazon. I just caution you to buy things that are easily counterfeit in person, or better yet, just buy them straight from the manufacturer.
title: “Watch out for counterfeits.”

content: Amazon is hit and miss, but mostly hit. I buy from them often; several items a month on average. I have only had a few problems with them. My biggest beef is their "temporarily out of stock" description, which always means: "permanently out of stock". If you avoid these, you will most likely enjoy the cheapest prices and most reasonable shipping on the internet. If you do have a problem, their customer service department is grade A, and really do seek to satisfy their customers, which is why I buy from them so often. It also helps that shipping is free on orders over $35! They really can't be beat! (Shameless plug: check out my review of their "Alchemy Mummified Palmistry Hand Gothic". It's a truish story!)
title: “Almost Perfect”

content: Amazon is a good company that was once great.  Their ease in ordering and paying is second to none.  The problem with their current policy is they are really cutting the price using sometimes very poor quality products from overseas.  Now their return policy and return procedure is again; 2nd to none.  Click a couple of buttons, take a printed return form to UPS and ship it with a credit already posted back to your account.  Amazon could return to greatness by doing more quality control and allowing reviews that were not only about the product but also about the company.  Good luck and God bless.
title: “Asian Amazon”

You can really find some great products for an even better price. Reading the reviews also helps me in making my final decision on a product. For those who don't mind not trying it before you buy it, Amazon is a great way to shop. You can never go wrong!

content:
If they break it we will replace it not questions asked.  I love that motto, that gives me the impression that you care and if you do I will definitely do business with you.

I bought a few things from Amazon online and I have never had a bad experience with them. I still have a few purchases from them that are still in use, quality products.  I absolutely  love their website, there are so much for the eyes to see.  It compels you to buy even when you are just browsing.

My friend regularly buys from them and she has never had a complaint other than buying the wrong sizes, that's her fault really.  I don't mind when she does though because I end up getting the products.

What I love about Amazon too is that they are an online electronic department store where you can shop for computers, apparel, computers, books, DVD's and more.  Not only that you can also make money on Amazon by selling your services, sell your apps, become an affiliate, advertise your products, you can self-publish with them,  You can actually make money on Amazon.  The different ways I mentioned and more.  Isn't that awesome.

Another plus is that there are different ways of making payment for purchases with their payment products:  Awards Visa card, store card, corporate credit line, you can also shop with points, they have their credit card marketplace and they also have currency converter. They cater to the needs of everyone.

Amazon provides products and services, services in the form of employment not only for those they employ in their immediate circle but for everyone else who take advantage of the services they offer.  Whether you want to self-publish with them, become an affiliate, advertise your products or become and Amazon vendor, and there are more to choose from.

Go ahead check out their website whether to buy something or do something, you'll be glad you do.
title: “Amazon great place to shop”

content: They keep you informed about businesses in your area that you may want to utilize.  This is great the info is u t d (up to date), concise, and valid.  There is a problem though.  Most of the time I'm, not in the market, for the business that they are keeping me informed about.  Result:  An unending slew of unsolicited e mails about businesses in my area that I am mostly, not in the market for, when I receive their e mail.  If they could stay in touch with you quarterly, send a brief questionnaire about what you might be looking for, in the next few months, travel, tires, electronics.  The constant receipt of e mails ruins the experience.  Lighten up Amazon, I know you're there and a lot of local business are affiliated.  I'll let you know when I need them, or give me a chance to let you know what I'm looking for, just don't bomb me with ads about local merchants.  It ruins the experience.

Not everything is cheaper on Amazon or worth getting by delivery. Make sure you really want the item or it's worth paying to return if you hate it. Having Amazon Prime is totally worth the membership if you make regular purchases and watch a lot of online shows/movies. Finally, Amazon Prime gives you free shipping but NOT free returns. Some of the lessons were painful but not enough to give up purchasing. I'm hooked for life.

content:
I love Amazon and, since I live in a rural area, use them a lot.  98% of the time they work flawlessly.  1.5% of the time they goof but the returns process works out fine.  But that last little bit is when there's a minor gaff which can be fixed easily but that fix is not in their playbook.  And there's no way to get a message to a customer service person.

Example is a while ago I bought an item which was battery operated (included!) and fairly large.  It was also packaged in one of those terrible blown plastic things but nobody noticed that the included batteries, easily visible in the online photos and indeed through the plastic, had been pilfered.  The main product was ok but I knew they would send replacement batteries if I could just let them know.  But no way to communicate that.  So I swallowed the cost of a couple of batteries.  I know, not a big deal but what if it had been some larger problem but just as simple to fix?
title: “One Major Flaw”

content: Amazon usually does things right the first time.  However recently my husband ordered a grooming arm for my dog grooming table which was supposed to come with a clamp.  The clamp was missing.  I didn't pay attention because I have a shorter arm that has the same clamp, so I just used that.  When I realized my new dog is going to need both arms for grooming I asked him to order me a clamp and he said "didn't the new one come with a clamp? It was supposed to!"  So sure enough, it was, and we had to file a request for a replacement.  The thing is, all the seller would have had to do is send us the clamp.  But instead the Amazon return/exchange process wasted money by sending us a whole new one and shipping the one with missing parts back.  Why?  If this is how Amazon is doing things it is totally wasting people's money.  Sure it didn't cost me and didn't inconvenience me except that they showed up to pick up the one I already had, two days before the replacement came, and we said no, you have to bring us the replacement first!   But the cost for all this extra freight from such an odd process goes into the system and applies to prices across the board.  Just send me the parts I need from one you already have, and defect THAT one of yours out.  There has to be a way to eliminate waste there.
title: “Kind of an odd exchange policy”

content: Update: I have changed my rating to 4 stars. Over the past (almost 4) years, I have seen Amazon go downhill. Shipping and returns remain excellent in most cases. Merchandise: has become more questionable and prices have skyrocketed. (Lookout for Outlet items in particular. Many are found on wish.com. Check it out). Clothing is super hard to pin down for quality unless you search for a particular brand. Off-brands permeate the site (when using just search parameters) with skewed sizes and questionable quality. Prices: I've seen stuff at DOUBLE the price of other online retailers (take a look at sparkling water for one). I don't use Prime anymore. It's not worth it to me. I've been a Prime member for years.  I love it. I order anything from toothpaste to televisions. I only order Prime unless it's a special item. No shipping pays for itself within in the first few shipments. I furnished my entire apartment using Amazon. Very few times (out of literally hundreds) have been disappointing.  My only caution:  Like any other store, online or otherwise, be careful of ignoring regular or higher prices lurking among all item types. Check Walmart.com for prices on items just to be sure the free Prime shipping is not costing your more in item price.  Also, love the Amazon Prime streaming video for movies and TV series. Walmart is supposed to add a similar shipping program on a pilot-program basis. We'll see.
title: “Update to: There really isn't a bad thing to say about Amazon”

content:
We are continually impressed with Amazon's ability to provide stellar customer service and their Prime systems are a great value to all of us that shop online on a regular basis. We always go to the Amazon site first to see what they charge to gauge deals others are offering. We've seen people trying to sell used stuff on Craigslist for more than buying a new one would cost on Amazon! Even if you don't shop at Amazon, just them being there with their low prices, great customer service and Prime shipping, has forced other online and brick and mortar retailers to lower their prices or up their act, so kudos to them for that, if nothing else!

All this having been said, they have one nagging and frustrating unacceptable issue. If you place a lot of orders they start combining them and shipping them separately and then charges with mystery dollar amounts start showing on your charge card statement that don't show up in your order history. So, then you have to call them and they explain that these two orders were combined or we did this and that and we're sorry they don't show up in your order history as they do on your credit card statement. This needs fixing! Just give me every order you charged to my credit card in my order history AS YOU CHARGED THEM so I can easily scroll through and check them off when my credit card bill arrives. PLEASE fix this Amazon - everything else is awesome!
title: “Great in every way except listing your order history on their site”

content:
Have been very pleased with Amazon as both a buyer and a seller.  As a buyer they get what you ordered at the price that was advertised.  Shipping is no hassle.

One issue that I have run into is when an item is no longer made by a manufacturer.  Amazon sometimes will advertise the replacement item using the product description for the old product.  If you want the replacement product fine.  But, if the replacement product is inferior to the original you will have a problem.  Sellers run into the same problem.  They aren't given the means to advertise the new product.  They have to advertise the replacement item using the old item description.  

As a seller they hold you to selling a quality product and making sure you get it shipped on time.  You must also provide a way for the customer to track their order.

The complaints I have with them as a seller is that it can be a nightmare to get all of your information on the correct screens.  The screens aren't the most user-friendly.  And if you don't get all of your information down you won't be paid in a timely manner.
title: “Very Pleased”

content: I've ordered 'stuff' from Amazon many times in the past; and when  I cannot find what I want on any 'general' website I go to Amazon - I cannot believe the variety of 'stuff' they seem to have.  Most of the time the prices aren't too bad - keeping in mind that the items come from individuals sometimes, and not straight from Amazon.  The shipping isn't bad - you have to expect to pay for deliveries - but occasionally I got free shipping.  Once you order whatever, you immediately get an E-mail verifying what you've ordered, and periodically another E-mail advising when the item will be (approximately) delivered.  They have some items that are overpriced  - and I choose carefully in those cases - but overall I like shopping at Amazon.  Especially when I want something specific & I don't want to drive all over to find it.  I recommend shopping with them; and paying for the item thru Paypal.   I have found various amazing items at Amazon that were no longer available thru regular channels. I would definitely recommend checking into Amazon when you want to buy something & cannot find it wherever you now live.

content: I've been buying from Amazon.com for several years now. You can find just about anything you want, and if you price-shop around a little, you'll get a fairly good buy.  The one thing I really don't like though, is that if you have Prime - as we did for while_ the shipping cost is actually built into the price of the item, making it harder to know if you got a good deal on said item or not.  We ascertained this by doing internet searches on the same item using several sellers - ebay, Froogle, overstock, etc. and comparing them to Prime items on Amazon. I was surprised at what I found - that shipping seemed to be included in the price on Amazon.  So buying into Prime isn't always such a good idea - maybe it's better to price-shop a bit and be patient with longer shipping times.
title: “A longtime customer. Usually a good source - just price-shop a little.”

Apart from that its really cool how much reading material is available for purchase on this site. Sometimes you find rare books and editions too. Keep it up Amazon.

content: I rarely have an issue in ordering from Amazon and hold a Prime membership and love it.  Recently I ordered a bag of dog food and paid $10 extra for overnight shipping because I needed it ASAP.  After waiting two days with no food delivered and no update to the shipping I wrote an email to customer service asking for assistance.  They replied quickly with an email that was not a canned response.  The agent investigate with the shipper and found out the delay, refunded the extra shipping cost and then followed up the next day to make certain the food arrived.  It was the perfect response in that situation and showed a willingness to go above and beyond to please a customer.
title: “Very prompt responses”

I order from Amazon quite frequently and only one time did I not receive my merchandise
from a merchant on Amazon. I did get a replacement of the item and it was of poor quality.It was a stuffed animal and it came so out of shape it did not stand up as it should
(I did not bother to complain about it). I have written many reviews and only one time was
refused to have it published (the complaint was about packaging). I have had packaging
problems before and have been allowed to mention them in my reviews, so do not know
what the problem was with that particular merchant. By packaging I mean it was not sent
in a box or "safe" packaging. I have not received anything broken, but it is a wonder that
I haven't. Anyway most of all I do love Amazon and all their product selection. Can find
most anything under the sun!

In two cases, the prices went up as I was still shopping so that my 15% savings for Subscribe and Save still ended up being a 5% savings despite the fact that I did subscribe 5 items. content:

It often takes a week or two to arrive, but it's always been in good condition and as described. I mostly purchase books for homeschooling as well as hard to find books. 

In my opinion, this is a great resource for the homeschooling family as curriculum can be purchased at a fraction of the price while still receiving good quality materials. 

I have created an account to sell on Amazon, but have never used it. Mainly because I do not find it user friendly for the seller.  I prefer to sell my used curriculum on Ebay.

content:
I have had an Amazon account for many years and never a bad experience. Last spring I wanted to catch up on a TV series that was streamed free on Amazon's Prime service. With an eye toward this Christmas's shipping requirements, I purchased the Prime service. The savings in shipping to my scattered family alone has paid for the service, and I have access to some good TV shows that I can't find anywhere else.

*** Editing ***
I have lost confidence in their ability to meet their shipping commitments, especially the "free next day delivery with orders over $35".  5 times I have ordered for next day delivery between my home and work accounts, twice it has arrived as promised. In one case, I bought an additional item to get the next day delivery because I had an immediate need for an item at work.  It took 9 days to arrive.  I have always gotten what I expected as far as the items have been concerned, but I will never trust their rapid delivery promises again. I dropped 1 star from my previous review due to this.
title: “I have had an Amazon account for many years and never...”

content:
I love Amazon. I think it's better than eBay most of the time. With Amazon I can get all kinds of great CDs, DVDs and video games for really low prices. What I like better about this than eBay, is with eBay you have to compete for everything and the infamous eBay Snipers almost always win. Plus eBay sellers are allowed to add little stipulations to auctions that contractually force the would-be-buyer to agree to in order to make a purchase. With Amazon, none of that is a problem because they don't let it work that way. The ONLY things I have to say negative about Amazon is that the sellers can't combine shipping prices which means if you buy 2 or more CDs from a seller, and they only have to spend $3 to ship them, you still have to pay $2.98 for shipping, for each CD. So the shipping on Amazon can you from a cart sub-total value of $5 and you end up with a $30 total. I also with sellers had to leave feedback for buyers as well. But with the way Amazon buying works it really doesn't matter. That's my ONLY gripe with Amazon. Other than that 1 thing they kill eBay in every single category you can think of. I talk to Amazon reps via-chat anytime I need an answer. Good luck contacting eBay reps!!!

Amazon I give 4 / 5 only because the shipping will bite you in the butt!!!
title: “I love Amazon”

content: I saw a few bad reviews and read what they where mostly having trouble with and just wanted to clear things up for the site. One big thing you need to look at is who you are ordering to product from. yes you are on Amazon but websites/manufacturers post there products on the site and you are really buying from them not always Amazon. So when your product comes late or you where over charged Amazon is not at fault. When you go to order something it will say where you are ordering the product from. If you have had a bad experiences with a product than you know not to order from that manufacturer again. If you don't pay attention to the site you order it from its your fault not Amazon. I'v only had a problem with one product. I ordered a product and never received it after two months i went to amazon and wrote a bad review on the product and the manufacturer of the product called me two days later asking me to take down the bad review and they would mail me the product. So i took down the products review and they took down my address again and once again i never received the product. but oh well. Amazon had nothing to do with the product they pretty much just helped me find it. iv had no other bad experiences with anything i'v ordered and i order all my friends and family's birthday and x-mas gifts from there. Thanks Amazon!
