content:
During this time of recovery from an economic downturn, people are saving money and have become more frugal than ever before. Many people have cut back on the luxury items and only focused on obtaining the necessities. Going to the movies with high priced tickets and popcorn was a luxury that many people cut back on.

As we began to embrace these cut backs we put together a list of websites to watch movies and/or tv on to little or no cost. We kept in mind a number of things such as affordability, reliability, clarity, and much more. Amaazon's instant videos are very easy to the navigate and sift through. The sites pros are that the prices for the movies are clearly displayed. They have a wide variety of free videos. It is a trusted and credible website that is not know to give viruses. It has great customer support. The cons is that all of the movies aren't free and the website doesn't have inviting and appealing colors that would make you want to log onto their website. But I would definitely recommend this site to a friend.

content: Did you ever wonder why this site is the No. 1 on-line retailer?  It has to be because they make sure the customer is satisfied.  You have a problem?  Contact them and its taken care of.  That also happens to be the only area where you might run into a problem since they outsource their help to some Third World country where the help is apparently reading from a script if you call, and just send you a scripted comment if you write.  Sometimes it won't even have a thing to do with your problem!  This is the one area Amazon needs to improve upon.  Otherwise, I can find items there I can't find elsewhere at a decent price - and always make sure to order at least $25 worth of stuff so I don't get stuck with paying shipping.  No complaints about the service - I seem to order at least $100 worth of stuff from them per month. content: I am a huge book lover and I always use Amazon to order back titles, classics and any new releases. I am not really a fan of most modern literature so I am lucky they have a big range of options from the middle American history which in my opinion is the most vibrant literary period. Sometimes you find products listed on the site which are not sold directly by Amazon, mostly these are second hand books so watch out for that but normally it is really clear. Obviously the shipping varies because it depends where the seller is located, so if you need your book fast then order direct from the main website. What I really need to praise is the customer service. I bought a book and the post service messed up so it got sent back and the order was automatically refunded. When I went back to order it again (not Amazon's fault, right?) the price was higher. I emailed them and they agreed to sell me the book at the original price I would have paid. I don't know if they always do that but their service was awesome!

With this feature, I don't bother to go out in the 100 degree weather here in Texas to buy something at Target...I order it from Amazon....and its here in 2 days !!

content: I've been an Amazon shopper since 2002 and spend quite a bit there on everything from food to $1800 diamond earrings to a lawnmower and generator. You must remember and honor their 30 day return rule for easy and swift returns' refund. As long as any seller shown on Amazon's site is part of the Amazon guarantee program, they really will act on your behalf to correct the issue or provide a full refund which I was pleased to experience. They will refund or replace if food is expired or there is some other legitimate reason. Sadly they have really cut back on the Friday Gold box deals, but then now I don't impulse buy as much either. I visit there everyday and can find just about everything I need or at least a link to an external site.

During the holidays, an item I ordered was delivered according to UPS but I never received and amazon sent out a new item OVERNIGHT with no questions asked. content:
Excellent selections.  Excellent Service.  Amazon has made our providing computer services a whole lot easier over the last few years.  I'd have to honest say that They are cheapest 90 - 95% of the time we price shop.

Better yet, we are PRIME customers.  For only $69.00 (or so) a year, we get free 2nd say shipping or for $3.99 get overnight shipping.  Regardless the size or weight.  We are probably placing 10-15 orders per week, and to be frank, I know they are losing money on us when it comes to the PRIME account.  But they have no limit.

As far a 3rd party purchases, I have on occasion had a problem with the 3rd party vendor.  In every case it only took 1 email to Amazon and I got a refund within hours.

As far as the reviewer complaining about Amazon selling so much more than books ... that really is a silly complaint.  If you are searching, you can specify to ONLY search books.  Come on, if it bothers you that much, then go buy your books at Barnes and Noble ... and pay more.  In our case, about 98% or all purchases are NOT books.

Seriously, what's NOT to like about Amazon.

On a scale of 1 to 10, they are a clear 10 for me and our business.
title: “Excellent selections”

content: I've ordered hundreds of times over the last five or six years and have always been satisfied. I especially appreciate how they really work to get holiday gifts delivered on time. content:
I've been ordering items off Amazon for the past 6 years, and I have yet to have a bad experience with them (knock on wood). Eveything to college textbooks to TVs, it all been hassle-free. Granted there are times when items aren't shipped out as fast as Amazon says they will be, but if it's going to be late, Amazon has always sent me emails explaining it will be late. 

The trick to making the smaller purchases worth it, like one reviewer stated, is to order $25 worth of stuff in a single order to qualify for the free shipping. You have to wait a few extra days most of the time, but if you can put up with the wait, it ends up being a good deal.

My one complaint (annoyance really) about Amazon are the fluctuating prices. I've seen item prices start at a specific amount drop by $50, then jump up by $75, only to drop by $60. All in a single week. My opinion: if you're considering purchasing something large at Amazon, watch the price for a few days before you buy it. Nothing is more annoying than a price dropping $50 a day after you buy the item.

Overall a great site to buy from!
title: “I've been ordering items off Amazon for the past 6...”

content:
I have used Amazon for years - and I have no major complaints. It's an OK site and usually the prices are very competative. Nothing is perfect but Amazon is near enough for me. I've been using it for long enough to know that any complaints I read are - presumably - few and far between - otherwise, given the amount I buy, I would have experienced at least some problems by now. The review system - maybe started by Amazon? - seems to concentrate seller's minds and also gives buyers a pretty accurate insight into a product's worth - providing you are sophisticated enough to detect false or misleading posts. 
But I'm also confused now. I went to this review posting to check my preconceptions that Amazon would have rave reviews and I have seen a few damning ones. So am I right to be turned off by a few damning reviews I've just read about Buyaparcel.com? Now I don't know what to do about them............

content:
Amazon.com can be a great place to shop for a wide variety of products.  Their inventory is rooted from a vast number of suppliers and probably more often than not you're actually dealing with them more-so with amazon being a middle-man.

At least, it seems that way to me.

And so, Amazon.com can be a great place to buy things -- even toys.  However, the prices for such items can be a bit on the high-end depending on the product.   Prices can vary from "new" or even "used".

Where toys are concerned, the prices can be ludicrous depending on when it was issued.  Toys that were issued yester-year may be on the limited-side and will have their prices inflated.

Sometimes you can surf through the various vendors that a particular product is catered from, sifting through their prices.  Something to be mindful of is that one vendor may appear to be cheaper, but their shipping is higher.

Like ebay, you want to check on the feedback of the seller.  Believe of not, even they can disappoint at times.  It's rare, but I've had it happen.  Sometimes similar looking products can be mixed up and that whole bag.  It's not something to be worried about, but aware of what you're prodding at.

So, if you're wishing to acquire that particular item or get a price feel for something, amazon.com can be a good place to scope out along with your other web surfing 'ventures.
title: “Amazon.com can be a great place to shop for a wide...”

content:
I have probably order over 50 times from amazon in the last 10 years and have never had any problems with any orders.  Never been shipped any wrong items (once was shipped the same item twice for a single order which customer service told me not to worry about it) and orders always arrive in a timely fashion.  Don't be scared about the delivery time frame for items with their super saver free shipping option -- it usually arrives before they say.  Only opt for the overnight / 2nd day shipping options if you absolutely need to have the item in hand by a certain date.

Be aware that if you buy items from amazon stores / sellers, those items won't qualify for free shipping, although the shipping is usually quite reasonable.  With amazon sellers, the items can come a little slower, so if possible I usually opt to get items from amazon themselves.

content:
I LOVE amazon.com, which I can't say for a lot of websites, especially commercial ones where I find it hard entrusting my credit card information!

Basically, Amazon.com is a fun, safe, and easy-to-use place that remains huge and popular, so I always feel assured it's reputable and other people have used it to their satisfaction. This store sells many, many products that anyone can need or want. So far I've bought books, including countless textbooks for when I was in college; music CDs and downloads; movie DVDs (including downloads straight to my computer); at least 3 headphones; special personal products that I couldn't find in stores; and I'm sure more than I can think of right now. The first reason I used this site was its reliability. I learned that they worked as a broker with some of the most dependable third-party online sellers on the planet. That means they do their research on the sellers so I don't have. All I do is look at the sellers' star ratings without having to look to bbb.org.

Second, I used this site because of their consistent offer of the lowest prices that I still cannot match with other sites, no matter how hard I try, (which is a good relief when you have to buy expensive supplies in college!) Also, they have multiple payment options. Sometimes I don't have my credit card handy, so I use the bank account number that they already have stored (and safely stored, too).

Another HUGE highlight of Amazon is the extra information they give on the lower half of the product page that helps the customer make the perfect purchase, such as the customer reviews, discussion areas, and recommendations. I've avoided a lot of bad purchases just by reading Amazon's reviews alone. The special features go further. I have also taken advantage of their Free Super Saver Shipping on qualified products over $25 and at least one of their gift cards. One card I printed out at the last minute when I forgot to buy a real gift! 

As a seller, I've had great success getting rid of unwanted textbooks, music CDs, and a keyboard stand, without paying for a listing like on other sites. I did not make large profits off of all my sales, but that's only because Amazon offers extremely low prices. But I've still sold them to an extremely large pool of eager buyers all over the world. 

Amazon keeps me interested in the product that I'm buying and coming back for more. Sometimes I look on the site just for the product reviews or recommendations. I've stuck with this site for years now and I hope that I won't have to give it up anytime soon.
title: “I LOVE amazon.com, which I can't say for a lot of websites,....”

content:
Amazon puts me at ease - Amazon has been a place which I started buying books from years ago, then graduated to music. Since 2007, I've been purchasing photo stuff from them. Today, I recieved a lens which I ordered last week, but the lens for some reason didnt communicate with my Canon XSi, got error messages. This is the first time ever that I had an issue with anything I got from Amazon directly or their vendors. 

I was a bit anxious about what might transpire now that I've received this item and it needs to be replaced. So, I started with their HELP pages for returns or credit, and an online email to them resulted in a reply within an hour stating that a new lens would be sent right away and that if I click on a web page which they gave, I could print out a free UPS shipping label to return the defective part. 

Since this is my first time ever having to deal with Amazon on a return, I have to say, its very impressive to see them respond so quickly and so positively without hassle or long protracted letter writing and phone calls.

My return is repacked ready to be dropped off at a UPS store or drop box, and my replacement lens has been shipped with a tracking number. They sent it at "2nd Day Air" with no charge to me. 

That is how businesses should conduct themselves and not make life miserable for a customer who is justified in returning a defective product. 

I am very impressed by Amazon, and if all turns out well as it seems to be, I will coninue to do business with them and will recommend them to others as well.
title: “Amazon puts me at ease”
